original: de las skyes pa dran pa gang gi yin pa de las dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam ni dri ba yin no //
analyzed: de las skyes pa dran pa gang gi yin pa de las dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam ni dri ba yin no //
translated: The question is simply this: What is the memory that arises from that? What is the cognition of the sense faculty?

original: len ni dran pa kho na las 'gyur 'o zhes gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: len ni dran pa kho na las 'gyur 'o zhes gnas skabs las so //
translated: The answer is: It arises from memory alone.

original: 'on te dran pa'i dus su yang don kho na las 'byung ba ni de la min pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te dran pa'i dus su yang don kho na las 'byung ba ni de la min pa ste /
translated: But if the object itself is the cause of memory, then the object itself would be the cause of the cognition of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i blor mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i blor mi 'gyur bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is demonstrated by the phrase â€œit is not from that.â€

original: de'i tshe na don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because at that time, the object does not exist.

original: yang na nyams su myong ba med pas dran pa nyid med pa'i phyir de'i bskyed byar mi 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½min pa'am de las zhes bya ba ste dran pa las so //
analyzed: yang na nyams su myong ba med pas dran pa nyid med pa'i phyir de'i bskyed byar mi 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa ni / min pa'am de las zhes bya ba ste dran pa las so //
translated: Or, the phrase â€œit is not from thatâ€ demonstrates that memory itself does not arise from the object, because there is no experience of the object.

original: de ltar don las gzhan la dran pa byung na yang bag chags sad pa las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar don las gzhan la dran pa byung na yang bag chags sad pa las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Thus, even when memory arises from something other than the object, it arises from the activation of the latent impressions.

original: de'i sad pa yang don nye ba'i dus na stobs dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam par g-yengs pas dus gzhan du ste /
analyzed: de'i sad pa yang don nye ba'i dus na stobs dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam par g-yengs pas dus gzhan du ste /
translated: And the activation of the latent impressions occurs at another time, when the object is present, because it is distracted by some other powerful factor.

original: don zhig pa'i dus su 'bad rtsol la sogs pas 'byung zhing dran pa skyed par byed la /ğŸ”½de yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir don zhig pa na yang dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don zhig pa'i dus su 'bad rtsol la sogs pas 'byung zhing dran pa skyed par byed la / de yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir don zhig pa na yang dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: When the object has disappeared, it arises through effort, etc., and produces memory.

original: dus gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And because it is not direct perception, it becomes the cognition of the sense faculty even when the object has disappeared. This is taught by â€œEven at another time.â€

original: 'grel par ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel par ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is clear in the commentary.

original: gzugs ni snga rol du dran pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ni snga rol du dran pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Form produces memory prior to it.

original: de nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: de nas rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But is it not direct perception that is conceptual?

original: gal te rim gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rim gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by â€œIf it arises gradually.â€

original: dran pa skyed par byed pa'i dus nyid du mngon sum yang skye bar 'gyur te /ğŸ”½nus pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa skyed par byed pa'i dus nyid du mngon sum yang skye bar 'gyur te / nus pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Direct perception also arises at the time of producing memory,

original: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because there is no difference in capacity. This is taught by â€œBecause there is no difference.â€

original: tha dad med phyir ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference, the prior and subsequent times are the same.

original: de ltar mthong ba de nyid ces bya ba ni des byas pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba de nyid ces bya ba ni des byas pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase â€œthat very seeingâ€ means that the seeing is qualified by that memory.

original: de dngos min na zhes bya ba ni de'i gzung ba las tha dad pa sgra dang dbyug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par las so //
analyzed: de dngos min na zhes bya ba ni de'i gzung ba las tha dad pa sgra dang dbyug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par las so //
translated: If it were not a real entity, then the memory would be produced from a real entity that is different from the object that is grasped, such as a word or a stick.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.ğŸ”½The second moment is the cause of perception.

original: skad cig pa yin pa'i phyogs la gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po ni dran pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: skad cig pa yin pa'i phyogs la gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po ni dran pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.

original: gnyis pa mngon sum gyi yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa mngon sum gyi yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The second moment is the cause of perception.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.

original: dbang po'i blo rgyu gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo rgyu gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second moment is the cause of perception.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.ğŸ”½The second moment is the cause of perception.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.ğŸ”½The second moment is the cause of perception.

analyzed: phyogs de la yang skad cig ma dang po'i yul can gyi dran pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'dzin bar byed pa'i mngon sum la don med pa @77b ste /

original: dgos pa med pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The second moment is the cause of perception.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.

original: don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The second moment is the cause of perception.ğŸ”½In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.ğŸ”½The second moment is the cause of perception.

original: brda dran ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brda dran ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the position that holds that the object is momentary, the first moment of form is the cause of memory.ğŸ”½The second moment is the

original: brda'i yul ni dran pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: brda'i yul ni dran pa'i yul yin la /
translated: The object of a sign is the object of memory.

original: de las gzhan pa ni mngon sum gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis la 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni mngon sum gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis la 'brel pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other is the object of perception. Therefore, these two are unrelated. This is the meaning.

original: 'grel par bshad pa ni thams cad du gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'grel par bshad pa ni thams cad du gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: The explanation in the commentary is clear in all respects.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni dpyod pas so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni dpyod pas so //
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ means by analysis.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ means conceptualization.

original: des zhes bya bas ni brda dran pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya bas ni brda dran pas so //
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ means by the memory of a sign.ğŸ”½Since a sign has a universal for its object, is not the memory that arises from its object also one that has a universal for its object?

original: brda ni spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de'i yul gyi dran pa las byung ba yang spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la spyi'i tsam 'dzin pa yin na ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brda ni spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de'i yul gyi dran pa las byung ba yang spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la spyi'i tsam 'dzin pa yin na ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it grasps a mere universal, then it is not a memory of a sign.

original: mngon sum dang rnam par rtog pa dag ni 'dzin pa dang zhen pa dag gis khyad par kho na yul du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rnam par rtog pa dag ni 'dzin pa dang zhen pa dag gis khyad par kho na yul du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that perception and conceptualization only make a distinction their object, by grasping and adhering to it.

original: khyad par la ltos pa ni khyad par la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par la ltos pa ni khyad par la zhen pa'o //
translated: Adhering to a distinction is dependent on a distinction.

original: de'i phyir mig dang zhes bya ba'i dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba la yin te des ni dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig dang zhes bya ba'i dang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba la yin te des ni dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the word â€œandâ€ in â€œeye andâ€ is for the purpose of including, and it does not mean that memory is included.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: If you ask, why is it not a sense consciousness?

original: gal te dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnad kyi don zer ba la /
analyzed: gal te dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnad kyi don zer ba la /
translated: The verse â€œIf it is not a sense consciousnessâ€ and so on is a summary of the key points.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas ma yin zhes bya bas dbang po'i khyab ches pa nyid du bstan pa'o//
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas ma yin zhes bya bas dbang po'i khyab ches pa nyid du bstan pa'o//
translated: The phrase â€œit is not a sense consciousnessâ€ indicates that it is not pervaded by a sense consciousness.

original: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya bas khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul gyi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya bas khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase â€œit is not the nature of its objectâ€ indicates that it is not the pervader.

original: yul gyis bskyed pa yang zhes bya ba 'di ni dpyod par bya ba ma yin nam /ğŸ”½dran pas byas pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba las mngon sum don gyi bskyed bya yin yang /
analyzed: yul gyis bskyed pa yang zhes bya ba 'di ni dpyod par bya ba ma yin nam / dran pas byas pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba las mngon sum don gyi bskyed bya yin yang /
translated: The phrase â€œit is not produced by the objectâ€ is something to be analyzed.ğŸ”½Even though it is the product of a direct perception of an object, it is not the product of that object.

original: de'i bskyed byar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bskyed byar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is because it is not seen to be different from memory.

original: der tha snyad 'dogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni gal te dngos su zhes bya ba 'dis brgyud pas bskyed par bya ba rjes su dpag par bya bas gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: der tha snyad 'dogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni gal te dngos su zhes bya ba 'dis brgyud pas bskyed par bya ba rjes su dpag par bya bas gcod pa yin no //
translated: But if you think that the reason is not seen, then this is answered by the phrase â€œin reality.â€

original: mngon sum du tha snyad gdags pa'i yul gyi shes pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas 'dri ba 'di dang lan yang btab pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du tha snyad gdags pa'i yul gyi shes pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas 'dri ba 'di dang lan yang btab pa yin te /
translated: This question and answer are made in terms of the special consciousness that is the object of conventional designation.

original: des na don gyi nus pas phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rtogs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: des na don gyi nus pas phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rtogs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no error, because the existence of non-conceptual consciousnesses such as the cognition of a double moon is not established on the ground that they are objects that are assisted by the capacity of an object.

original: 'on te 'dis dbang po'i bskyed pa nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la sogs pa bsdus pa de lta na mngon sum nyid du @78a * //ğŸ”½yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'dis dbang po'i bskyed pa nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la sogs pa bsdus pa de lta na mngon sum nyid du @78a * //ğŸ”½yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if this example illustrates the production of a sense consciousness, then the cognition of a double moon and so on would be direct perception.

original: rtogs par byed pa nyid yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can du tha snyad pa'i med pa dang / yod pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa nyid yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can du tha snyad pa'i med pa dang / yod pa dag yin gyi /
translated: The reason for the existence and non-existence of the cause of the understanding is the conventional non-existence and existence.

original: rgyu nyid tsam ni yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can dag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu nyid tsam ni yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can dag ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The mere cause is not the reason for the existence and non-existence. The meaning of the statement is:

original: go bar byed pa nyid mthong nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid mthong nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having seen the cause of the understanding.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa ni rgyu nyid med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa ni rgyu nyid med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the non-existence of the cause is not the cause of the understanding of the non-existence of the other reason for the designation of the conventional.

original: go bar byed pa nyid du ma 'khrul pa can nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa'i nges par sbyor ba'i yul yin la /
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid du ma 'khrul pa can nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid du tha snyad gdags pa'i nges par sbyor ba'i yul yin la /
translated: The non-erroneous cause of the understanding is the object of the application of the designation of the uncommon.

original: de skyed par byed pa ni lkog shal la sogs pa la ba lang gi tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ni lkog shal la sogs pa la ba lang gi tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The cause of that is like the designation of the conventional â€œcowâ€ in relation to the dewlap, etc.

original: de tsam las byung ba nyid du rtogs pa'i yul des kyang yul can de'i nges par sbyor ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni de yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de tsam las byung ba nyid du rtogs pa'i yul des kyang yul can de'i nges par sbyor ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni de yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: The object that is realized as the cause of that cognition is also the object that is connected to the subject, the cognition.

original: go byed nyid kyi yul dbang po'i tha snyad la yod pa yin gyi yul gyi tha snyad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: go byed nyid kyi yul dbang po'i tha snyad la yod pa yin gyi yul gyi tha snyad la ni ma yin no //
translated: The term â€œobjectâ€ exists in the convention of the sense faculty that is the illuminator, but not in the convention of the object.

original: de'i yul gyi chos te yul can sbyar ba nyid ni nges par sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de'i yul gyi chos te yul can sbyar ba nyid ni nges par sbyar ba ste /
translated: The object of that is the property of the object, which is the connection to the subject.

original: mtshon pa'i rgyu la ni yul go byed yin la /
analyzed: mtshon pa'i rgyu la ni yul go byed yin la /
translated: The cause of the illustration is the object that is the illuminator.

original: yul can go bya yin no //
analyzed: yul can go bya yin no //
translated: The subject is the object that is the illuminated.

original: de ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa go bya'i'o //
analyzed: de ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa go bya'i'o //
translated: Because it is not the object, the cognition of two moons is the illuminated.

original: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ste zla ba gnyis shes pa mngon sum yin yang yul ma yin na gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ste zla ba gnyis shes pa mngon sum yin yang yul ma yin na gzhan gyi ste /
translated: If that is the cognition of two moons, even though it is a direct perception, it is not the object.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: How can it be the object of another, that is, inference?

original: dbang po nyid de bzhin du ma yin te shes pa gcig nyid la ltos na de'i rgyu yin zhing rgyu ma yin pa yang yin zhes yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par can ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni dbang po nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po nyid de bzhin du ma yin te shes pa gcig nyid la ltos na de'i rgyu yin zhing rgyu ma yin pa yang yin zhes yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par can ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni dbang po nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sense faculty is not like that.  If it is in relation to a single cognition, it is both the cause and not the cause of that cognition.  It cannot be distinguished as existent and nonexistent. This is indicated by â€œThe sense faculty itself . . . â€

original: 'dis ni shes pa gcig nyid la yul ni ma nges pa yin par bstan to //ğŸ”½yul la brten pa zhes par tha snyad gdags pa la dngos su 'am /ğŸ”½brgyud pas kyang khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa gcig nyid la yul ni ma nges pa yin par bstan to // yul la brten pa zhes par tha snyad gdags pa la dngos su 'am / brgyud pas kyang khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This shows that the object is not ascertained in a single cognition.ğŸ”½It is not directly or indirectly understood as the basis of the designation of the object.

original: 'on te yul la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'on te yul la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: This is indicated by â€œIf it is the basis of the designation of the object . . . â€

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i tha snyad nyid 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i tha snyad nyid 'thad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: up to â€œTherefore, the designation of the sense faculty itself is tenable.â€

original: gang gi tshe yang don gyi mthu las ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang don gyi mthu las ni /
translated: Moreover, from the power of the object,

original: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
translated: it arises correctly.

original: zhes bya bas nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las shes pa'i snang ba tha dad par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes bya bas nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las shes pa'i snang ba tha dad par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, it is shown that the appearance of consciousness is differentiated from the near and the not near.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes par @78b 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes par @78b 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, it is not an error of consciousness such as the perception of two moons,

original: khyad par gyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir 'di'i rtog pa med pa nyid kyang de'i mtshan nyid kho na las yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir 'di'i rtog pa med pa nyid kyang de'i mtshan nyid kho na las yin te /
translated: because it is a special occasion. The absence of conceptualization in this case is also due to its definition.

original: des na rnam par 'gas kyang gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis gzhan du 'dri ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par 'gas kyang gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis gzhan du 'dri ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only a question of something else, because of the appearance of clarity in some way.

original: yul gyis kyang mtshon par nus pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yul gyis kyang mtshon par nus pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The statement Is it not possible for the object to indicate? and so on is only the assertion of others.

original: de ltar na yang yul gyi go byed nyid med na yul can gyi nges par sbyar ba yang ldog pa yin par bstan pa ni de'i phyir tha snyad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang yul gyi go byed nyid med na yul can gyi nges par sbyar ba yang ldog pa yin par bstan pa ni de'i phyir tha snyad ces bya ba ste /
translated: Even so, if there is no indication by the object, the application of the subjective ascertainment is also excluded. This is shown by Therefore, the convention.

original: rtags zhes bya ba ni yul can gyi nges par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rtags zhes bya ba ni yul can gyi nges par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The term sign refers to the application of subjective ascertainment.

original: khyad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi go byed nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi go byed nyid kyis so //
translated: The word â€œespeciallyâ€ means that it is the cause of understanding the object.

original: 'grel pa byed pas ni go byed nyid du ma mthong ba'i nges par sbyor ba ni des khyab pa yin pa de'i rtags ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas ni go byed nyid du ma mthong ba'i nges par sbyor ba ni des khyab pa yin pa de'i rtags ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The author of the commentary, not seeing that it is the cause of understanding, connects it with the word â€œnecessarily,â€ and he shows that the reason for that is the logical mark of nature.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the word â€œpreceded by a conceptual thought.â€

original: mtshan nyid pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyang ston pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyang ston pa ni /
translated: He also shows that it is a logical mark of reality.

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the word â€œultimately.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa can nyid bstan nas spyi'i yul can nyid kyi tshig 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa can nyid bstan nas spyi'i yul can nyid kyi tshig 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having shown that it is non-conceptual, he shows that the word â€œhaving a universal as its objectâ€ is contradictory.

original: spyi'i yul can ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the word â€œhaving a universal as its object.â€

original: 'gal ba can nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba can nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: He shows that it is contradictory.

original: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the word â€œaggregates.â€

original: gsum char yang don mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsum char yang don mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all three are the same in meaning.

original: gal te tshogs pa don dam pa ma yin na de'i shes pa rtog pa med pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa don dam pa ma yin na de'i shes pa rtog pa med pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: If the collection is not ultimate, then its cognition would be non-conceptual alone.

original: don dam pa nyid ma yin par der sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa can kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa nyid ma yin par der sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa can kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the imagination of what is not real as the ultimate is only the imagination of what is not real.

original: mang po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mang po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the many.

original: de lta yin pa nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni de rnams las gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin pa nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni de rnams las gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Even though this is so, they are different from those.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams yin la /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'gro ba'i rgyu rnams yin la /
translated: The other object refers to the causes of their approach.

original: ma mthong ba la sogs pa ste nye bar 'gro ba'i rgyu de rnams kyis ma 'brel pa rnams kyi 'brel pa skyes pa ni bsags pa yin par bshad pa bstan pan i /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la sogs pa ste nye bar 'gro ba'i rgyu de rnams kyis ma 'brel pa rnams kyi 'brel pa skyes pa ni bsags pa yin par bshad pa bstan pan i /
translated: The non-perception, etc., of those causes of their approach, the connection of those that are unconnected is explained as the collection.

original: don gzhan dang ni zhes bya ba'o spyi'i sgra'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don gzhan dang ni zhes bya ba'o spyi'i sgra'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The other object refers to the general term. The meaning of the general term is shown in the verse:

original: rdul phra rnams zhes bya ba ste shes pa gcig la snang ba'i du ma rnams ni spyi'i yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rnams zhes bya ba ste shes pa gcig la snang ba'i du ma rnams ni spyi'i yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The subtle particles. The many that appear to a single cognition are the general.

original: nye ba la skra shad rnams snang ba ji skad de bzhin du thag ring ba la tha dad pa ma yin nam tha mi dad par snang ba ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang dgag bya ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba la skra shad rnams snang ba ji skad de bzhin du thag ring ba la tha dad pa ma yin nam tha mi dad par snang ba ni rdul phra rab rnams la yang dgag bya ma yin te /
translated: Just as the hairs are seen near, so too, are they seen far away, without difference or without non-difference.

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i gnod byed tha dad pa snang ba ni rdul phra rab rnams la mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i gnod byed tha dad pa snang ba ni rdul phra rab rnams la mi srid de /
translated: The refutation does not apply to the atoms, because the appearance of difference is not possible for atoms.

original: @79a * // steng dang 'og gi cha'i dbye bas snang bzhin pa ni gcig la yang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: @79a * // steng dang 'og gi cha'i dbye bas snang bzhin pa ni gcig la yang 'gal ba med de /
translated: For, while appearing as divided into upper and lower parts, there is no contradiction in their being one.

original: thag ring po nas skra shad snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: thag ring po nas skra shad snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the appearance of hairs near at hand.

original: thag ring po na skra shad snang ba ni nye ba nyid bzhin du tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba yang rmongs pas smra ba yin te /
analyzed: thag ring po na skra shad snang ba ni nye ba nyid bzhin du tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba yang rmongs pas smra ba yin te /
translated: The statement that the appearance of hairs far away is different from the appearance near at hand is the confused talk of the confused.

original: snang ba'i dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-difference of the appearance would follow.ğŸ”½The demonstration of this is:

original: 'og ma mngon sum la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'og ma mngon sum la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The lower is manifest.

original: 'khrul pa nyid ces bya ba ni thag ring po na skra shad snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ces bya ba ni thag ring po na skra shad snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The confused talk of the confused is like the appearance of hairs far away.

original: 'khrul pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: You may think that it is like an inferential cognition that is mistaken.

original: 'khrul pa yin yang rab rib las skyes pa bzhin du rtog pa med pa nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa yin te /ğŸ”½mi sbyor ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de skad du rnam par rtog bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang rab rib las skyes pa bzhin du rtog pa med pa nyid kyi sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa yin te / mi sbyor ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de skad du rnam par rtog bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though it is mistaken, it is a cognition of blue, etc. just as when it arises from diseased vision, because it is not a conceptual cognition.ğŸ”½It is taught that it is not a conceptual cognition because it has the nature of not combining.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni /
translated: It is said that it is conceptual

original: 'dzin pa la ni mngon phyogs pa //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la ni mngon phyogs pa //
translated: when it is directed toward the apprehender.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the words â€œwhen it is directed toward the apprehender.â€

original: de las bzlog pa la ni zhen pa las bzlog pa la'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa la ni zhen pa las bzlog pa la'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the opposite of attachment.

original: de lta na de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid du tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo mngon sum gyi yul yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta na de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid du tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo mngon sum gyi yul yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though that is the object of direct perception, which is the nature that is not different from its own characteristic,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rtog pa ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni 'o na de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rtog pa ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa ni 'o na de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: why is there a conception of atoms? It is taught that if that is so, thenâ€¦

original: rnam dbye 'di zhes bya ba ni gcig tu stug pa'i rags par snang ba'i rdul phra rab rnams la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam dbye 'di zhes bya ba ni gcig tu stug pa'i rags par snang ba'i rdul phra rab rnams la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The division of this is a mistake with regard to the atoms of gross objects that appear as a single mass.

original: 'jig rten gyi bsam pas ni de dag kho na phra mo nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni snang bas snang bzhin pa rnams la spyi zhes brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsam pas ni de dag kho na phra mo nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni snang bas snang bzhin pa rnams la spyi zhes brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: But the idea of the world is that the division of those very atoms into subtle parts is the universal that appears in the appearance of what is present.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa la tha dang pa rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa nyid zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa la tha dang pa rtogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is just what we accept, etc. means that there is no awareness of itself.

original: du ma shes pa gcig la snang ba ni spyi yin na /
analyzed: du ma shes pa gcig la snang ba ni spyi yin na /
translated: If the appearance of many cognitions in a single cognition is a universal,

original: phra mo'i yid kyis yul du ma la shes pa gcig gam du ma yang cig car skyed par byed par mi nus so snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: phra mo'i yid kyis yul du ma la shes pa gcig gam du ma yang cig car skyed par byed par mi nus so snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: then the subtle mind cannot generate a single or multiple cognition simultaneously with regard to many objects.

original: gal te skye mched gcig yin yang //
analyzed: gal te skye mched gcig yin yang //
translated: Even if there is a single sense base, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel ba'o //

analyzed: de gcig pa yang zhes bya ba ni du ma 'dzin pa 'gal ba can gcig nyid ci las yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œThat oneâ€ is connected with â€œwhat is the one that is contradictory to the apprehension of multiplicity?â€

original: til sogs tha dad la ji ltar //
analyzed: til sogs tha dad la ji ltar //
translated: â€œHow is it with regard to different sesame seeds?â€

original: zhes bya ba sogs pa ni rnam 'grel yin te yul nye ba la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sogs pa ni rnam 'grel yin te yul nye ba la'o //
translated: and so on is the commentary, with regard to the proximity of the object.

analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni lnga po rnams kyi chod pa yang zhes bya @79b bas so //
translated: â€œAlready explainedâ€ is by the phrase â€œthe five are also obstructed.â€

original: mgyogs pa yin yang cig car ma yin par bstan pa ni de rnams nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgyogs pa yin yang cig car ma yin par bstan pa ni de rnams nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œEven though they are fastâ€ is taught to be not simultaneous.

original: blo thams cad kyang skad cig pa nyid kyis myur bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo thams cad kyang skad cig pa nyid kyis myur bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

original: rim dang cig shos kyi rnam pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rim dang cig shos kyi rnam pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: dus mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: de tsam rgyu mtshan nyid yin na rim pa min pa yin la /

analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan la lar yang de bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: sngon gyi mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //

analyzed: phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa du ma shes pa gcig la snang bar 'gyur bar bstan pa la du ma ni gcig ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: gal te sna tshogs de gcig na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs ngo bo'i phyir blo dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the various natures, they are applied to the mind.

analyzed: tshig tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag ni dngos po'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa la gegs med pa ni rab tu 'phel ba @80a * //
translated: The absence of obstruction to the establishment is the increase.

analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa ni yul rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan gang dag gi yin pa de dag go //
translated: The establishment of the connection is that which is the reason for the determination of the object.

original: snang ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
analyzed: snang ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
translated: The appearance is by itself.

original: 'on te snang ba ni ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni /

translated: But if the appearance is in some way,

translated: it is the appearance of the sky as below.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning.ğŸ”½In one,

analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni rim pa dang ldan pa'i'o //

original: du ma ni rim pa ma yin pa'o //

original: gcig ni snang ba zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni snang ba zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //

analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i mi bden pa'i shes pa dag nyid can gyi ma rig pa yang shes pa bzhin du mi bden pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: snang ba tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIt is mere appearance.â€

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: â€œIts natureâ€ means the nature of the gross.

original: gcig la zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la'o //
translated: â€œIn oneâ€ means in the whole.

original: mang po rnams nyid shes pa gcig la snang ba rags pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: mang po rnams nyid shes pa gcig la snang ba rags pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If one thinks that many things are not the objects of the convention of the gross which appears in one cognition,

original: lings po gcig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lings po gcig ces bya ba ste /
translated: â€œa single massâ€ is said.

original: nye ba dang cig shos kyi skra shad kyi snang ba'i dbye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: nye ba dang cig shos kyi skra shad kyi snang ba'i dbye ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is a distinction between the appearance of the hair strands in the near and far regions,

original: 'di la yang dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la yang dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so too there is a distinction here. This is the meaning.

original: de lta na yang yan lag de rags pa'i snang ba can ril po gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang yan lag de rags pa'i snang ba can ril po gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even so, that part would be a single whole with the appearance of a gross object. To demonstrate this, he says:

original: ji ste rdul phra rab dengs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ste rdul phra rab dengs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf it is a part of a subtle particle.â€

original: tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha bzhin du gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i yang pha rol gyi cha 'dzin pas gnas pa'i gzhal bya mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol gyi cha bzhin du gcig yin pa'i phyir de'i yang pha rol gyi cha 'dzin pas gnas pa'i gzhal bya mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as there is a distinction between the near and far parts, since it is one, the part of its far side would also be apprehended. Thus the object of the extended appearance would be seen. To demonstrate this, he says:

original: pha rol gyi cha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe part of the far side.â€

original: yongs gcod na yin zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i'o //
analyzed: yongs gcod na yin zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i'o //
translated: â€œIf it is a determinationâ€ refers to the nature of blue.

original: phyi rol ltar @82a * //
analyzed: phyi rol ltar @82a * //
translated: â€œLike the externalâ€

original: zhes bya ba ni ser po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ser po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: refers to the nature of yellow.

original: tha dad snang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid dang / steng dang 'og gi cha'i bdag nyid kyis kyang brkyang ba'i snang ba la'o //
analyzed: tha dad snang ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid dang / steng dang 'og gi cha'i bdag nyid kyis kyang brkyang ba'i snang ba la'o //
translated: â€œThe appearance of differenceâ€ refers to the appearance of the extended object as having the nature of blue and yellow and as having the nature of the upper and lower parts.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du'o //
translated: â€œIndividuallyâ€ means mutually.

original: rang dang gzhan rig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan rig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œKnowledge of self and otherâ€ means

original: rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa yang phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa yang phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that self-knowledge and other-knowledge do not mutually engage.

original: de dag las gcig don nas gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: de dag las gcig don nas gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed na /
translated: If one of them were to posit the other,ğŸ”½then it would follow, absurdly, that seeing and so on would be devoid of nature.

original: de la yang mthong ba la sogs pa gcig por bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang mthong ba la sogs pa gcig por bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
translated: This is what is being demonstrated.

original: de la gcig ni med pas kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ni med pas kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: â€œOne of themâ€ is what is being referred to.

original: de tha dad la brten pa yin zhes bya ba ni shes pa tha dad pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de tha dad la brten pa yin zhes bya ba ni shes pa tha dad pa la brten pa'o //
translated: â€œIt is based on differenceâ€ means that it is based on different cognitions.

original: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni shes pa bslad pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni shes pa bslad pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: â€œIt is itself erroneousâ€ means that the cognition itself is erroneous.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i shes bya dang shes pa dag gi ngo bo la de las phyi rol ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i shes bya dang shes pa dag gi ngo bo la de las phyi rol ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the object of apprehension and the apprehender, the object of knowledge and the knower, is such that they are different from each other.

original: gzugs su rung ba dang thogs par byed pa de'i phyir gzugs dang tshor bar byed nyams su myong bar byed pas tshor ba dang / mtshan ma kun tu shes pas 'du shes dang / rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po la sogs pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang thogs par byed pa de'i phyir gzugs dang tshor bar byed nyams su myong bar byed pas tshor ba dang / mtshan ma kun tu shes pas 'du shes dang / rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po la sogs pa ma yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: The aggregates and so on are not characterized by such functions.

original: phung po la sogs bye brag gi //ğŸ”½zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs bye brag gi // zhes pa ste /
translated: The aggregates and so on are not different.

original: mtshan nyid bral ni mtshan nyid spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bral ni mtshan nyid spangs pa'o //
translated: Free from characteristics means devoid of characteristics.

original: 'dis phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul gyi stong pa nyid dang / bar mas rnam par rig par smra ba'i tshul gyis dang / dang pos ni dbu ma'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul gyi stong pa nyid dang / bar mas rnam par rig par smra ba'i tshul gyis dang / dang pos ni dbu ma'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the first verse teaches the emptiness of external objects, the second verse teaches the emptiness of the VijÃ±aptimÄtra system, and the third verse teaches the emptiness of the Madhyamaka system.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams phyi dang nang la sogs par mngon par zhen pa can gyi shes pa bskyed la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams phyi dang nang la sogs par mngon par zhen pa can gyi shes pa bskyed la /
translated: The consciousness of ordinary beings is generated by the conception of external and internal things and so on.

original: ma rig pa ni de lta bu'i shes pa gzhan gyi bag chags kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni de lta bu'i shes pa gzhan gyi bag chags kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Ignorance is taught to be the cause of the latent impressions of such other cognitions.

original: ji lta'i rang rkyen la zhes bya ba ste phyi rol lam nang gi rkyen sad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta'i rang rkyen la zhes bya ba ste phyi rol lam nang gi rkyen sad par byed pa'o //
translated: In the case of the conditions of that, i.e., in the case of the conditions, external or internal, that awaken it.

original: ltos nas ni de la ltos nas so //ğŸ”½de las ni ma rig pa ste de'i bag chags sad pa yin la des nye bar bslad pa'i bdag nyid gang dag gi yin pa de dag gi ma rig pa de tshu rol mthong ba rnams te /
analyzed: ltos nas ni de la ltos nas so // de las ni ma rig pa ste de'i bag chags sad pa yin la des nye bar bslad pa'i bdag nyid gang dag gi yin pa de dag gi ma rig pa de tshu rol mthong ba rnams te /
translated: In dependence, i.e., in dependence on that.ğŸ”½From that, i.e., from the awakening of the latent impressions of ignorance, those whose nature is affected by that are those who see only what is near at hand.

original: de lo na nyid ma mthong ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de lo na nyid ma mthong ba rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who see only what is near at hand are those who do not see reality.

original: de dag gi /
analyzed: de dag gi /
translated: For them,

original: de nyid de ni rigs ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid de ni rigs ma yin //
translated: that reality is not possible.

original: zhes bya ba ci las she na /ğŸ”½de dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci las she na / de dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: What is that?ğŸ”½Those who see only what is near at hand.

original: tshu @82b rol mthong ba rnams la mi srid pa'i phyir bslad pa med na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshu @82b rol mthong ba rnams la mi srid pa'i phyir bslad pa med na zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is impossible for them, it is connected with â€œwithout error.â€

original: 'dis ni de kho na nyid bstan pa la snod ma yin pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de kho na nyid bstan pa la snod ma yin pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that they are not vessels for the teaching of reality.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snod ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don bzhag nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snod ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don bzhag nas /
translated: Therefore, because they are not vessels, having set aside the meaning of reality,

original: glang chen gzigs stangs nyid mdzad nas //
analyzed: glang chen gzigs stangs nyid mdzad nas //
translated: he looked at them with the gaze of an elephant.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mkhyen kyang mi mkhyen par bstan nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mkhyen kyang mi mkhyen par bstan nas so //
translated: Although he himself knew, he pretended not to know.

original: phyi rol dpyod la zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol dpyod la zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la dpyod pa ste /
translated: With regard to the external analysis, he analyzed the aggregates, etc.

original: bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du mdzad pa ste /
translated: He did this in order to make them understand selflessness.

original: 'jig rten 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is because he wanted to engage them in the world.

original: sna tshogs par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sna tshogs par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: With regard to the statement that he accepted the variety, it is because the aspects of consciousness cannot be distinguished.

original: rnam par dbye bar nus pa nyid yin na sna tshogs pa nyid la du ma nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar nus pa nyid yin na sna tshogs pa nyid la du ma nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if they can be distinguished, then variety is necessarily manifold.

original: shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya bas shes pa gcig gi byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya bas shes pa gcig gi byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: With regard to the statement that he distinguished consciousness, he demonstrated the conformity of a single consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de las tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir byed pa bzhin du gcig yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de las tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir byed pa bzhin du gcig yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is not different from that blue, etc., therefore, like the agent, it is taught to be one.

original: gzhan brten med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan brten med ces bya ba'o //
translated: â€œ Without depending on anotherâ€ is stated.

original: gal te gzhan la brten pa bzhin du cis mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la brten pa bzhin du cis mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, â€œWhy is it not like that which depends on another?â€

original: mthong nus ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong nus ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: â€œ It is not seenâ€ is stated.

original: gzhan gyis mthong bar mi nus pa gang gi yin pa de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang rang gi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba go bar byed pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong bar mi nus pa gang gi yin pa de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang rang gi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba go bar byed pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is not seen by another is understood by another person through its own aspect, and it is like that, but not through another aspect. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar mthong ba po de nyid kyi phyis 'di'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa gzhan bdag gir 'dzin pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du zhen nas blo la tha dad par byed pa yin no snyam du sems la /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba po de nyid kyi phyis 'di'o zhes bya ba'i shes pa gzhan bdag gir 'dzin pa'i gnas ma yin pa nyid du zhen nas blo la tha dad par byed pa yin no snyam du sems la /
translated: In that way, the seer himself, after that, is not the basis for the cognition of â€œthis,â€ and he is attached to the thought that he makes a difference in the mind.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ In thatâ€ refers to

original: rnam par rtog pas 'byed pa ni blo las gzhan pa yin la gzhan tha dad pa ni phyi rol nyid du yin gyi rang rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas 'byed pa ni blo las gzhan pa yin la gzhan tha dad pa ni phyi rol nyid du yin gyi rang rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the differentiation by conceptualization is other than the mind, and that which is different as other is external, not self-awareness.

original: yan 'gar du zhes bya ba ni shes pa rjes su 'jug pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yan 'gar du zhes bya ba ni shes pa rjes su 'jug pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: â€œ In some other wayâ€ means without the engagement of consciousness.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni blo ni zhes bya dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni blo ni zhes bya dang sbyar ro //
translated: â€œ Thereforeâ€ is to be connected with â€œthe mind.â€

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni blo'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni blo'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: â€œ The sameâ€ is due to the engagement of the mind.

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo las so //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo las so //
translated: â€œ Differentiationâ€ is from the mind of form.

original: yan 'gar du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bral ba'i 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: yan 'gar du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bral ba'i 'dzin pas so //
translated: â€œ Apprehension in some other wayâ€ is apprehension without sound.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bral ba'i gzugs la sogs pa snang @83a * //ğŸ”½ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sgra dang bral ba'i gzugs la sogs pa snang @83a * // ba'i dus su'o //
translated: â€œ At that timeâ€ is when form and so on appear without sound.

original: sngar gyi snang ba zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi snang ba zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: â€œ The previous appearanceâ€ is the appearance together with that.

original: tha mi dad pa zhes pa ni sgra dang cig shos kyi snang ba dag go //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa zhes pa ni sgra dang cig shos kyi snang ba dag go //
translated: â€œ Nondifferentâ€ is the appearance of sound and the other.

original: sgra 'di de'i tshe yod kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra 'di de'i tshe yod kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ should be applied to the statement â€œit is not consciousness because it is hidden at that time.â€

original: don nyid la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid la ste sgra'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: don nyid la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid la ste sgra'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: â€œIn the object itselfâ€ means in the external itself, in the nature of sound.

original: shes pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid du'o //
analyzed: shes pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nyid du'o //
translated: â€œApart from consciousnessâ€ means in the external itself.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i shes pa yang ngo //
translated: The apprehended and apprehender are blue, etc., and its consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Blue, etc., are blue, yellow, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa lhan cig dmigs pa'i nges pas ji lta ba nyid yin na de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang phan tshun yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang de'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa lhan cig dmigs pa'i nges pas ji lta ba nyid yin na de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang phan tshun yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if blue, etc., and its consciousness are the same in reality by the principle of the necessary simultaneity of the apprehension of different things, then in the same way blue, etc., are mutually the same in reality.

original: tha mi dad pa ni rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin pa la dbye ba med do //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin pa la dbye ba med do //
translated: There is no difference in nature, and there is no difference in kind.

original: de med pas kyang khyad par du bya yang ngo //
analyzed: de med pas kyang khyad par du bya yang ngo //
translated: And because of the absence of that, there is no distinction.

original: tha dad pa yin na ji ltar gnyis su med pa ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ji ltar gnyis su med pa ngo //
translated: If they are different, how can they be nondual?ğŸ”½If they are different, how can they be nondual?

original: tha dad pa yin na ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin zhe na tha dad med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin zhe na tha dad med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If they are not different, then they are not different.

original: dbye ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par du bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par du bya ba'i'o //
translated: The â€œdistinctionâ€ is the distinction that is made.

original: gzhan gyis sgro btags pa'i dbye ba ni mthong ba la ma dmigs pas tha snyad kyis dgag par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sgro btags pa'i dbye ba ni mthong ba la ma dmigs pas tha snyad kyis dgag par byed pa yin te /
translated: The distinction that is imputed by others is refuted by convention, because it is not perceived in the visual experience.

original: sgro btags pa med na dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgro btags pa med na dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If there were no imputation, there would be no refutation.

original: tha dad ces bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the words â€œif they are different.â€

original: rnal 'byor bas kyang 'das pa la sogs pa mngon du byed pa na da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas kyang 'das pa la sogs pa mngon du byed pa na da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Even for the yogi, when he perceives the past, etc., it becomes present.

original: skye ba 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the words â€œin this birth.â€

original: snang bzhin par 'dod pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma mngon par 'dod pa'i'o //
analyzed: snang bzhin par 'dod pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma mngon par 'dod pa'i'o //
translated: The â€œwakingâ€ refers to the desire to perceive the past and the future.

original: sad pa rnams zhes bya bas rmi lam bden pa mthong ba'i dus su snang ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sad pa rnams zhes bya bas rmi lam bden pa mthong ba'i dus su snang ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words â€œthose who are awakeâ€ indicate the reason for the appearance of the truth of the dream at the time of the dream.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //ğŸ”½brtan pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshe ring ba nyid dang 'brel pa can gyi ri mo la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis so // brtan pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshe ring ba nyid dang 'brel pa can gyi ri mo la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: â€œThusâ€ means by the nature of non-apprehension.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshe ring ba nyid rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshe ring ba nyid rtog pa yin no //
translated: â€œBecause of the realization of stability, etc.â€ means that because of seeing the signs of the painting, etc., which are connected with longevity, one imagines future longevity.

original: rgyu yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rgyu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rgyu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œAlso, because of the causeâ€ means because of seeing the cause of the realization.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo las sam 'bras bu las ri mo la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni tha dad par ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo las sam 'bras bu las ri mo la sogs pa'i rgyu las ni tha dad par ro //
translated: â€œThereforeâ€ means that stability, etc. are different from the cause of the painting, etc., which is the nature of the future effect.

original: brtan pa nyid ces bya ba ni ri mo la sogs pa'i rtags su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid ces bya ba ni ri mo la sogs pa'i rtags su brjod pa'o //

analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad dmigs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: tshogs gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshogs gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: â€œBecause another set of conditions is involved.â€

original: phyi rol gyi khyad par skyes pa yang tshogs pa'i khyad par nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khyad par skyes pa yang tshogs pa'i khyad par nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi /

original: don med pa la ltos nas skyes pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don med pa la ltos nas skyes pa ma yin zhing /

original: gzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rang gi snang ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi thams cad ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi snang ba'i rgyu nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi thams cad ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: rgyu'i dngos po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by â€œexcept for the cause.â€

original: sngon po nyid ni rdul phra rab re re ldog pa rtogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sngon po nyid ni rdul phra rab re re ldog pa rtogs pa yin zhing /
translated: Isnâ€™t the individual exclusion of each atom blue,

original: rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: and not the inclusion of all?

original: de'i phyir spyir 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyir 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is a universal.

original: 'di rdul phra rab rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rdul phra rab rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rdul phra rab ma grub na de'i spyi ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan pa ni gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: lu gu rgyud dang bong ba yang rdul phra rab tu rnam par phye ba mthong ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams su de dag da ltar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they exist now as atoms.

original: yan lag can dang lhan cig pa'i yan lag mi 'dzin na ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can nyid khyad par can du 'dzin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag can dang lhan cig pa'i yan lag mi 'dzin na ba lang la sogs pa yan lag can nyid khyad par can du 'dzin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If one does not apprehend the parts together with the whole, then the distinctive nature of the whole, such as a cow, is taught:

original: ji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can one apprehend the wholeğŸ”½Without apprehending the parts?

original: yan lag gi @85b khyad par med kyang yan lag can ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas yan lag can gzhan las khyad par can yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: yan lag gi @85b khyad par med kyang yan lag can ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas yan lag can gzhan las khyad par can yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: Even though there is no difference in the parts, the whole is distinctive from another whole by its own nature alone.ğŸ”½If one does not see the distinctive parts,

original: lkog shal sogs mthong med par ni //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog shal sogs mthong med par ni // zhes bya ba'o //

original: yon tan dang yon tan can dag rim gyis 'dzin pa la rang dbang yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma yin zhing yon tan can yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can dag rim gyis 'dzin pa la rang dbang yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma yin zhing yon tan can yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement â€œNor is it endowed with qualitiesâ€ is to show that the apprehension of the possessor of qualities and the qualities in sequence is not independent.

original: yon tan la sogs ldan pa'ang min //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs ldan pa'ang min // zhes bya ba'o //

original: gzung ba'i yul tsam khyad par ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul tsam khyad par ma yin zhing /

original: khyad par du bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba yang ngo //

analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid kyis 'dzin pa yang rnam par rtog pas yin la /

analyzed: cha tsam la mchog tu 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni / brjod par 'dod pa gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: It is shown that the apprehension of a part as supreme is

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

translated: â€œEven though there are manyâ€ means that it is a thing that is the nature of the opposite of what is not that.

translated: The Autocommentary states:ğŸ”½If one grasps the arrangement of the body as something to be displayed,ğŸ”½

translated: The Commentary explains: If it were the case that the self is the nature of the arrangement of the parts, then the SÄá¹ƒkhya would not apprehend the parts simultaneously.

original: de tsam lnga'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam lnga'i zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba ni /

translated: â€œThe transformation of soundâ€ is the sound of the word â€œvase.â€

analyzed: lan lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The remaining replies are by â€œquicklyâ€ and so on.

original: rdul phra rab gcig cig car 'dzin pa bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i du ma'i chos can 'dzin pa yang cig car kho na ma yin nam /

translated: Just as a single atom is apprehended, is it not the case that many phenomena that possess the qualities of impermanence, being produced, and so on are apprehended simultaneously?

analyzed: de bzhin du mig phye ba kho nas yod pa dang bum pa dang / rdzas dang mi rtag pa dang byas pa dang zlum po zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis mthong ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, when the eyes are open, the vase is seen to have the nature of existence, being a vase, being a substance, being impermanent, being produced, and being round.

original: thun mong ma yin pa bzhin du yin la dbang po'i rjes su byed pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa bzhin du yin la dbang po'i rjes su byed pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the cognition of substance, etc. is not direct perception, because it is dependent on the sense faculties.

original: thal ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: thal ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /

original: chos can thams cad las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can thams cad las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the phrase â€œthe exclusion of all other things.â€

original: de'i tha dad pa ni de tha dad pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i tha dad pa ni de tha dad pa ste ;
translated: Its differentiation is the differentiation of that.

original: 'dzin pa des brtags pa'i tha dad pa can te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa des brtags pa'i tha dad pa can te /
translated: It is the differentiation that is examined by that apprehension.

original: nye bar brtags pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid yin gyi brtags pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid yin gyi brtags pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the variety that is examined, not by another examination.

original: du ma'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de'i tha dad par 'dzin pa'i brtags pa'i tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de'i tha dad par 'dzin pa'i brtags pa'i tha dad pa'o //
translated: That which is the nature of the manifold is the differentiation of that, the differentiation that is examined by the apprehension of its differentiation.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is dependent on the eye, etc.

original: 'di ltar ma he la sogs pa'i tshogs bor nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma he la sogs pa'i tshogs bor nas /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the group of buffaloes,

original: ba lang gi tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni de bor nas 'di rnam shes so zhes rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba ni de bor nas 'di rnam shes so zhes rtogs pa'o //

original: 'di rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say that you understand the similar nature of these,

original: nye ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba rtogs pa ma yin te /

original: ring ba na gnas pa yang dngos po de rnams nyid nye ba ma yin pa skra shad bzhin du nye bar rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: ring ba na gnas pa yang dngos po de rnams nyid nye ba ma yin pa skra shad bzhin du nye bar rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Even though distant, the very things that are not near are understood as near, like a hair-net.ğŸ”½The superimposition of nondifference on those appearances that are different is error.

original: tha dad pa'i snang ba de dag la tha mi dad pa'i sgro 'dogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag tsam ni rig pa'i yul yin gyi spyi la sogs pa ni ma yin na /

translated: These are merely the objects of awareness, not universals and so on.

original: gang gis de 'dzin pa las mngon sum rtogs pa can du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis de 'dzin pa las mngon sum rtogs pa can du 'gyur ba yin /

analyzed: don 'di nyid ni gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dogs pas chos can du ma'i ngo bo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad las log pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa yin la / de'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni chos can dang chos la @87a * //
translated: This very point is taught by the qualm, â€œIf it is called â€˜non-conceptual,â€™ etc.,â€ and the response, â€œThe nature of many phenomena, etc.â€ Direct perception apprehends a thing that is the opposite of everything.

original: sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba la dpyod par byed pa yin par brda'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba la dpyod par byed pa yin par brda'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bstan pa ni /

original: du ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it follows convention is â€œthe nature of many.â€

original: khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par gyi ngo bor rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rtogs zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par gyi ngo bor rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rtogs zhes zer ba la /

original: rang nyid rig bya ste /
analyzed: rang nyid rig bya ste /
translated: It is to be known by itself.

original: rang gi ngo bos rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rig par bya ba'o //

original: ldog par brtags pa yang de nyid kyis yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ldog par brtags pa yang de nyid kyis yin no snyam du sems pa la /

original: bstan min pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bstan min pa'i zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: bstan pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i yul nyid ma yin par mtshon pa'o //

original: dbang po lnga'i yul gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de'i chos kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i yul gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de'i chos kyang ma yin nam /

analyzed: de ji ltar de 'dzin pa'i shes brtogs pa med pa yin zhes zer ba la phan tshun dpen par ni zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa phan tshun mi ldan pa rtogs pa yin gyi gzhi gcig ma yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: gang nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //

original: mthong ba la sogs bas ma phye ba'i gzugs kyi gzugs nyid gser gyi bum pa bzhin du yan lag can gcig ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste /

original: gzugs kyang tha dad par mthong bar nus pa ni du ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyang tha dad par mthong bar nus pa ni du ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: dbye bar mi nus pa'i gzugs ni shes pa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa yin gyi phyi rol gyi ma yin par bstan pa ni /

original: de bzhin du gzugs ni rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs ni rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the same way, form is to be known by itself.â€

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni dbang po'i yul la zhen par byed cing de ma yin pa'i shes pa bzhin du rtogs par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that conceptualization does not cause the object to be grasped as it is, as does non-conceptual cognition, he says,ğŸ”½â€œConceptualization is the grasping of the object of the sense faculties.â€

original: ngo shes pa ni tshang ma nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni tshang ma nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The recognition is that it is not all.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: Here, â€œalsoâ€ refers to conceptual thought.

original: mngon sum dang mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /

original: mngon sum gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi khyad par te /

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rang gi ngo bo ste mngon sum gyi rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par yin pa ni de'i rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ste mngon sum gyi rtogs par bya ba'i khyad par yin pa ni de'i rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Its own nature is the particular object of understanding of perception. That is its understanding.

original: sgra las byung ba la snang ba ni tshig las byung ba'i shes pa gnod pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la snang ba ni tshig las byung ba'i shes pa gnod pa med pa yin te /

original: yul gang dang gang du 'byung ba'i phyir de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gang dang gang du 'byung ba'i phyir de ni tshad ma ma yin te /

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //

original: ngag las byung ba de ni the tshom las khyad par med par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag las byung ba de ni the tshom las khyad par med par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That verbal cognition is not taught to be indistinguishable from doubt.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œAlsoâ€ refers to that.

original: khyer la shog ces bya bas gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyer la shog ces bya bas gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The expression â€œbring itâ€ is understood to be an imperative.

original: phyogs can ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /ğŸ”½de'i @88a * //
analyzed: phyogs can ni ma yin pa ma yin nam / de'i @88a * //
translated: But is not the word-meaning partial?

original: phyir 'khrul pa med pa yin te gzugs gzhan bkag pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: phyir 'khrul pa med pa yin te gzugs gzhan bkag pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not non-erroneous, for the other form is excluded.

original: 'o na ji ltar khyer nas 'ongs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khyer nas 'ongs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that the word-meaning is the form that is brought, then how is it that you say â€œbrought and so onâ€?

original: tshig gi shes pa ni rang bzhin pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir don la nges pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: tshig gi shes pa ni rang bzhin pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir don la nges pa can ma yin na /
translated: The cognition of the word-meaning is not certain with regard to the object, because there is no natural connection.ğŸ”½And the cognition of the word that precedes it is just like that.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ngag gi shes pa yang de kho na bzhin du'o zhes bstan pa ni mi 'khrul pa yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ngag gi shes pa yang de kho na bzhin du'o zhes bstan pa ni mi 'khrul pa yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThere is no non-erroneousâ€ means that there is no non-erroneous cognition of the word-meaning.

original: bya ba la zhes bya ba ni bskul pa la'o //
analyzed: bya ba la zhes bya ba ni bskul pa la'o //
translated: â€œWith regard to the actionâ€ means with regard to the urging.

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa las mngon sum gyi yul tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa las mngon sum gyi yul tha dad pa yin na /
translated: Since the object of direct perception is different from the object of conceptual thought,

original: ji ltar 'di mngon sum las byung ba dang / ji ltar dbang po'i rjes su byed pa ni gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mngon sum las byung ba dang / ji ltar dbang po'i rjes su byed pa ni gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: how can it arise from direct perception? And how can it follow the sense faculty? It is established as something else.

original: 'o na ji ltar chos can gyi chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos can gyi chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that the word-meaning is the property of the subject, then how is it that you say â€œthe property of the subjectâ€?

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching from the perspective of the verse is:

original: chos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //

original: ldog pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyis brtags pa des skyed pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyis brtags pa des skyed pa ste /
translated: It is produced by that conceptualization through the distinction of apprehending the opposite.

original: rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yin la de'i phyir dbang po'i rjes su 'di gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yin la de'i phyir dbang po'i rjes su 'di gzhan du grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is an emanation of conceptualization, and therefore it is established as other than the sense faculties. This is the meaning.

analyzed: ldog pa'i tshig gis don 'dzin pa la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the words of the opposite are the cause of apprehending the object is:

original: de la da ltar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar ni zhes bya ba'o //
