original: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pa nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the very conceptualization that is the exception is:

original: gal te kha dog dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te kha dog dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is color, etc.

original: sngon po zhes dbyibs kyis phye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po zhes dbyibs kyis phye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is distinguished by shape as blue.

original: sngon po ma yin ba las tha dad pa'i dbyibs ni sngon po la sogs yin na /
analyzed: sngon po ma yin ba las tha dad pa'i dbyibs ni sngon po la sogs yin na /

original: des na sngon po ma yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na sngon po ma yin par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: then it is taught that it would not be blue, etc.

original: de tshe bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de tshe bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: At that time, it is the so-called pot, etc.

original: sngon po las tha mi dad pa yang sngon po ma yin pa la yin na /ğŸ”½des na de sngon por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po las tha mi dad pa yang sngon po ma yin pa la yin na / des na de sngon por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is not blue, then it is not the shape of blue.

original: sngon po ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas dbyibs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa zhes bya ba nas dbyibs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage from â€œIt is not blueâ€ up to â€œthe shape, etc., of blueâ€ is summarized in the following.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po ma yin pa yang sngon po'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / gang gi phyir yang sngon po'i dbyibs sngon po ma yin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po ma yin pa yang sngon po'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / gang gi phyir yang sngon po'i dbyibs sngon po ma yin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not blue, it is not included in the category of blue, and since the shape of blue is not blue, it is not included in the category of blue.ğŸ”½The appearance of difference as nondifference is simply a delusion that has another cause, like the redness of crystal.ğŸ”½The meaning of the passage from â€œIf it is not blueâ€ up to â€œthe shape, etc., of blueâ€ is summarized in the following.

original: tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa snang ba ni rgyu mtshan gzhan can gyi 'khrul pa kho na yin la shel la dmar po nyid bzhin du zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa snang ba ni rgyu mtshan gzhan can gyi 'khrul pa kho na yin la shel la dmar po nyid bzhin du zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Since it is not blue, it is not included in the category of blue, and since the shape of blue is not blue, it is not included in the category of blue.

analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'on te spyir nges pa can 'jug par 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'di ni rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: To this he says, â€œIt is not a cognition of anything at all,â€ğŸ”½because it is not a cognition of anything at all.

analyzed: 'di dang mthong ba med pa la khyab pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: don gyis go ba yang ma yin te / mthong ba tsam yod pas gzhan du yang 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Nor is it understood by implication,

analyzed: dmigs pa la zhes bya ba'o //

translated: Even so, it is precisely the object that is one,

analyzed: gzhan du na 'di nyid 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la de yang zhes bya ba ste mthong ba'i gcig pa nyid do //

analyzed: de ni skad cig re re zhig gzhan yin pas 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin te /

translated: All of this is consistent, he teaches, by â€œEach one.â€

analyzed: nges pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo 'dzin byed du mthong ba ni rang gi snang ba'i rtog pas blangs pa'i ngo bo'i dbye ba ni snang bzhin pa'i dngos po dang 'brel par rung ba nyid kyi phyir 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la brtags pa'i rang
translated: The essence of the opposite of all is seen as the apprehender. The essence of the division taken by one's own appearing thoughts is suitable to be connected with the appearing thing, and therefore it is thought that it becomes the apprehender.

analyzed: bzhin tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste brtags pa la rung ba nyid do //

translated: The so-called non-realization is the pervader of the suitability of seeing in those. The opposite of the pervader is non-thought. That is the meaning.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis 'dres pa'i ngo bo mngon sum gyis mthong ba ni dpyod pa dang bral ba yang mna' bskyal bas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis 'dres pa'i ngo bo mngon sum gyis mthong ba ni dpyod pa dang bral ba yang mna' bskyal bas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The seeing of the mixed essence by direct perception of the essences of the investigated is also realized by an oath free from analysis.

original: khra bo ni de lta bu'i snang bas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: khra bo ni de lta bu'i snang bas khyab pa yin la /
translated: A multicolored thing is pervaded by such an appearance.

original: khra bo ma yin pa'i snang ba'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: khra bo ma yin pa'i snang ba'i yul ma yin te /
translated: A non-multicolored thing is not the object of the appearance.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni sna tshogs min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni sna tshogs min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is contradictory to the pervader.

original: mthong ba ni don nye ba kho na las 'byung na res 'ga' ba yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba ni don nye ba kho na las 'byung na res 'ga' ba yin la /
translated: Seeing arises only from the presence of an object, and it is intermittent.

original: rtog pa las byung ba'i brtags pa ni rtog pa las byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba ma yin la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba can nges yul can du byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rtog pa las byung ba'i brtags pa ni rtog pa las byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba ma yin la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba can nges yul can du byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Imagination, which arises from conceptualization, does not arise from conceptualization, and it is not intermittent. It is not contradictory to the pervader, and it is not limited to a specific object.

original: nyams su myong ba la yang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la yang 'byung ba ste /
translated: It also occurs in experience.

original: de las gzhan ba las dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid du khyad par med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba las dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid du khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between it and the other, in that it is not produced from the sense faculties.

original: de dbang po rnams kyi yang nyams su myong ba'i don nyid kyis gzhan du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dbang po rnams kyi yang nyams su myong ba'i don nyid kyis gzhan du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is established as different from the sense faculties, because it is the experience of the sense faculties.

original: res 'ga' ba'i zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: This is demonstrated by the phrase â€œit is intermittent.â€

original: ; snga mas ni rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag gi ngo bo'i dbye ba dang / bar mas ni yul gyi dbye ba dang / tha mas ni rgyu'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ; snga mas ni rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag gi ngo bo'i dbye ba dang / bar mas ni yul gyi dbye ba dang / tha mas ni rgyu'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the difference in the nature of the conceptual and non-conceptual; the second half shows the difference in their objects; and the last half shows the difference in their causes.

original: rnam pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa'i yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam pa'i yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas so //
translated: â€œBy the difference in their aspectsâ€ means by the difference in the aspects of their objects.

original: brkyang pa'i sngon po dmigs na cha bzhin du cha med pa yang mthong ba'i yul ma yin nam /
analyzed: brkyang pa'i sngon po dmigs na cha bzhin du cha med pa yang mthong ba'i yul ma yin nam /
translated: If one perceives a blue extension, is not the partless object also seen as a part?

original: gang gi phyir skra shad rnams nye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skra shad rnams nye ba bzhin du /
translated: Because of the appearance of the hairs,

original: thag ring ba la yang snang ba'i yul ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /ğŸ”½gal te dkar sogs yong gyur kyang //
analyzed: thag ring ba la yang snang ba'i yul ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni / gal te dkar sogs yong gyur kyang //
translated: one thinks that the partless object is not the object of perception, even though it is distant.ğŸ”½If it were white, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it would be like the hairs.

original: gcig po de ni phyi rol ma yin te dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / shes pa gcig ni nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig po de ni phyi rol ma yin te dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / shes pa gcig ni nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That one is not external, because it cannot be divided, and because the one consciousness is internal.

original: phyi rol ni dbye bar nus pa nyid kyi cha shas can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol ni dbye bar nus pa nyid kyi cha shas can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The external is divisible, because it has parts.

original: phyi rol de gcig tu khas blangs kyang mthong ba'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol de gcig tu khas blangs kyang mthong ba'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i ma yin te /
translated: Although external objects are accepted as being one, they are objects of seeing, not of conceptualization,

original: de'i ngo bo la reg pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la reg pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the nature of that is not realized. This is the meaning.

original: blo rnams don gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag gi yul gcig yin pa la'o //
analyzed: blo rnams don gcig nyid yin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang rtog pa med pa dag gi yul gcig yin pa la'o //
translated: The cognition of one object means that the object of conceptual and non-conceptual cognitions is one.

original: 'dis ni sgra dang dbang po'i rjes su dpag pa las rang gi nus pa rjes su 'brang ba gang dag gis res 'ga' 'ga' zhig kho nar dngos po'i cha gcig rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang @90a * //ğŸ”½bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgra dang dbang po'i rjes su dpag pa las rang gi nus pa rjes su 'brang ba gang dag gis res 'ga' 'ga' zhig kho nar dngos po'i cha gcig rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang @90a * // bsal ba yin no //
translated: This also refutes the idea that the power of sound and the senses is such that sometimes only a part of the object is realized.

original: skra dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas kyang dngos po'i cha nyid rtogs pa ma yin te tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas kyang dngos po'i cha nyid rtogs pa ma yin te tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hair and so on are not realized as parts of the object because they are different from it.

original: tha mi dad na yang sgra las bzhin du dbang pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur te dngos po nyid bzhin du rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: tha mi dad na yang sgra las bzhin du dbang pos kyang rtogs par 'gyur te dngos po nyid bzhin du rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: If they are not different, then just as sound is cognized by the ear, the object would also be cognized by the ear, because it is suitable to be just like the object.

original: ;'on te dngos po gcig nyid tshogs pa'i dbye ba de dang des de lta de ltar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ;'on te dngos po gcig nyid tshogs pa'i dbye ba de dang des de lta de ltar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But if the object itself is cognized in this way and that way by the differentiation of the collection,

original: thag ring ba dang cig shos la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: thag ring ba dang cig shos la sogs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: then it is like a distant object and a nearby object.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i dbye ba tshogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis yin gyi yul gyi dbye bas ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i dbye ba tshogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis yin gyi yul gyi dbye bas ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /

original: blo rnams don gcig yin yang zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The apprehension of the form that is related to the agent is refuted in regard to the visible cow and so on.

original: 'grel par byed pa po'i bshad pa ni mthong ba rtogs pa med par ni zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel par byed pa po'i bshad pa ni mthong ba rtogs pa med par ni zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the agent in the commentary should be understood to be indicated by the phrase â€œwithout the realization of seeing.â€

original: gzhan dag na re snang du rung ba'i khra po la sogs pa la ba lang ba lar zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dag gis ldan pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par mi 'gyur zhes rjes su dpag pa sun phyung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re snang du rung ba'i khra po la sogs pa la ba lang ba lar zhes brjod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dag gis ldan pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par mi 'gyur zhes rjes su dpag pa sun phyung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the inference is refuted because a black cow, for example, which is suitable to appear, is called a cow, and because it is not the case that it is not the entity that is associated with the concept.

original: gal te 'dra ba mthong ba las de'i rjod byed dran pa yin na de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi de nyid yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba mthong ba las de'i rjod byed dran pa yin na de dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi de nyid yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the memory of the word is due to seeing the similarity, then it is similar to that, but how could it be that?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma mthong ba'i yul ma yin pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid du zhan pa las so //ğŸ”½snga ma'i don shes pa tshad ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma mthong ba'i yul ma yin pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma gcig pa nyid du zhan pa las so // snga ma'i don shes pa tshad ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is the same as the prior and subsequent, which are not the objects seen.

original: mthong ba tha dad nyid yin na //
analyzed: mthong ba tha dad nyid yin na //
translated: If you think that the cognition of the prior object is valid,

original: zhes bya @92a * //
analyzed: zhes bya @92a * //
translated: then it is said,ğŸ”½â€œThe seeing is different.â€

original: ba ste / mthong ba tha dad rnams te /
analyzed: ba ste / mthong ba tha dad rnams te /
translated: The seeing is different.

original: yul tha dad pa can rnams yul la goms pa'i bag chags kyi snying po can rang gi yul gyi khyad par nges par byed cing /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa can rnams yul la goms pa'i bag chags kyi snying po can rang gi yul gyi khyad par nges par byed cing /
translated: Those that have different objects have the essence of the latent potentialities of the object. They ascertain the specific object.

original: dran pa'i yul can rnams kyang de ltar ma nges pa rnams ni de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: dran pa'i yul can rnams kyang de ltar ma nges pa rnams ni de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: Those that have memory as their object also ascertain the object in that way.

original: nges pa skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa skyes pa'i don to //
translated: They generate the ascertainment that this is that.

original: rtsod pa'i rnyog las rgyal ba can //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rnyog las rgyal ba can //
translated: They are victorious over the mud of disputes.ğŸ”½They obtain clear memory.

original: dran pa gsal po thob pa dang // dam pa'i lam bdag nyid du gyur //
analyzed: dran pa gsal po thob pa dang // dam pa'i lam bdag nyid du gyur //
translated: They become the nature of the path of the holy.

original: srid pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro //
translated: They go beyond the ocean of existence.

original: 'di ltar yang gzugs ni mngon sum gnyis po dag gis 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gzugs ni mngon sum gnyis po dag gis 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Thus it is said that form is apprehended by two direct perceptions:

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang nges drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam shes kyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs shing /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang nges drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam shes kyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs shing /
translated: by the sense consciousness and by the mental consciousness induced by that.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang yid kyi'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa de ni 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir dri ba sngon du 'gro ba ni sngar myong ba ni 'dzin par na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang yid kyi'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa de ni 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir dri ba sngon du 'gro ba ni sngar myong ba ni 'dzin par na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The earlier scholars who explained that the phrase â€œby the mental facultyâ€ and so on is correct.ğŸ”½The question is, â€œIf the object is not apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, how is it apprehended?â€ğŸ”½The answer is, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the prior moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€

original: snga ma'i dbang po'i rnam shes kyi skad cig snga mas bzung ba nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa bzhin du'am /ğŸ”½dbang po'i rnam shes kyi dus nyid du de'i yul 'dzin pa ni de bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa la yod pa ma yin na de nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa bzhin du'am /
analyzed: snga ma'i dbang po'i rnam shes kyi skad cig snga mas bzung ba nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa bzhin du'am / dbang po'i rnam shes kyi dus nyid du de'i yul 'dzin pa ni de bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa la yod pa ma yin na de nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa bzhin du'am /
translated: Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the mental consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the mental consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of mental consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of mental consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of mental consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of mental consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of mental consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of mental consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du yin pa de dang grub pa gcig pa ma yin pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du yin pa de dang grub pa gcig pa ma yin pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness.â€

original: sngar myong ba zhes bya ba ni dus mtshungs par 'dod pa'i bsams pas yin gyi bskyed pa'i bsams pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar myong ba zhes bya ba ni dus mtshungs par 'dod pa'i bsams pas yin gyi bskyed pa'i bsams pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended by the first moment of sense consciousness, it is apprehended by the second moment of sense consciousness.â€ğŸ”½Or, â€œJust as the object is apprehended

original: 'brel pa ni skyed pa'i bsam pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni skyed pa'i bsam pa kho na yin te /
translated: The connection is the intention to produce.

original: de bstan pa ni sngar myong ba dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni sngar myong ba dran pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is â€œremembering what was previously experienced.â€

original: dbang po'i byed pa 'das na yid kyis ni phyi rol gyi nye ba ston par mi byed de long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa 'das na yid kyis ni phyi rol gyi nye ba ston par mi byed de long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: When the function of the sense faculty has passed, the mental faculty does not reveal external objects, because it would follow that the blind and so on would not exist.

original: ma mthong 'dzin na zhes bya ba ste dbang po'i yul ma yin pa 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: ma mthong 'dzin na zhes bya ba ste dbang po'i yul ma yin pa 'dzin na'o //
translated: The teaching of that is â€œIf it apprehends what is not seen.â€

original: yid kyi ni yid kho na'o //
analyzed: yid kyi ni yid kho na'o //
translated: The mental faculty is only the mind.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni long ba ma yin pa'i'o//
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni long ba ma yin pa'i'o//
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ means not blind.

original: snga ma'i dbang po'i shes pa'i dus su yid kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i dbang po'i shes pa'i dus su yid kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is not at the time of the sense faculty consciousness of the past.

original: don med pa'i phyir la gnyis pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir la gnyis pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Because it is meaningless, nor is it at the second moment,

original: dbang po'i rnam shes kyi skad cig bzhin du skad cig phyi ma'i yul la dbang po'i bya ba yod na don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam shes kyi skad cig bzhin du skad cig phyi ma'i yul la dbang po'i bya ba yod na don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the function of the sense faculty exists in the object of the subsequent moment, like the moment of the sense consciousness, it is meaningless.

original: med na yang long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar @92b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na yang long ba la sogs pa med par thal bar @92b 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, it would follow that the blind and so on would not exist.

original: 'on kyang snga ma'i dbang po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma'i yul nyid da ltar mthong bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma'i dbang po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma'i yul nyid da ltar mthong bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: However, the object of the moment of the former sense consciousness is seen now.

original: da ltar yang de nyid mthong bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar yang de nyid mthong bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is not that the object of the former sense consciousness is seen now.

original: skad cig ma'i phyir 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyir 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is, â€œBecause it is momentary, the past is not seen.â€

original: shes pa bzhin du de'i yul yang 'das pa ni mthong bar mi nus pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du de'i yul yang 'das pa ni mthong bar mi nus pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, like consciousness, its object, the past, cannot be seen.

original: 'on te skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la mthong bar nus pa yin pa de lta na yang yid kyi mngon sum skad cig pa ma yin no zhes khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod byar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la mthong bar nus pa yin pa de lta na yang yid kyi mngon sum skad cig pa ma yin no zhes khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod byar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: But if the position is that it is possible to see it because it is not momentary, then even in that case, mental direct perception is not momentary.

original: skad cig mi na na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig mi na na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is, â€œIf it is not momentary.â€

original: mthong ba snga mas snga ma'i dus bzung ba yin la da ltar bas ni ltar ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs la dran pa nyid bzhin du ji ltar tshad ma ma yin zhes bsam dgos so //
analyzed: mthong ba snga mas snga ma'i dus bzung ba yin la da ltar bas ni ltar ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs la dran pa nyid bzhin du ji ltar tshad ma ma yin zhes bsam dgos so //
translated: If the position is that the former seeing apprehends the former time and the present apprehends the present, then it must be considered how it is not a valid knowledge, like memory.

original: nyams su myong bzhin pa ni nyams su myong ba nyid kyang dran pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong bzhin pa ni nyams su myong ba nyid kyang dran pa yin gyi /
translated: The experience of the object is the memory of the experience.

original: nyams su myong par gyur pa la ni dbang po las skyes pa snga ma nyid kyis thob pa'i bar du 'jug pa'i yul ston pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong par gyur pa la ni dbang po las skyes pa snga ma nyid kyis thob pa'i bar du 'jug pa'i yul ston pa ni /
translated: The object of the operation of the sense faculty is taught to be the object that is obtained by the sense faculty that arises first.

original: de las lhag pa'i byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no other operation beyond that.

original: yid kyi ni tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi ni tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The mind does not have another valid cognition.ğŸ”½The statement that the mind is the agent of the operation of the object is the reply.

original: bya ba bsgrubs can zhes bya ba ste 'jug pa'i yul gyi las gang gis rnam par gcod pa'i bya ba dbang po las skyes pa bsgrubs pa de la khyad par ni lhag pa'i byed pa po'o //
analyzed: bya ba bsgrubs can zhes bya ba ste 'jug pa'i yul gyi las gang gis rnam par gcod pa'i bya ba dbang po las skyes pa bsgrubs pa de la khyad par ni lhag pa'i byed pa po'o //
translated: The operation of the sense faculty that is the agent of the operation of the object that is the object of the operation is the special operation.ğŸ”½The statement â€œthe sense facultyâ€ is the reply.

original: dbang po can zhes bya ba ni lan yin te gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni yid kyi'o //
analyzed: dbang po can zhes bya ba ni lan yin te gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni yid kyi'o //
translated: The statement â€œthe othersâ€ refers to the mind.

original: rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa'i bar du nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa'i bar du nges pa'o //
translated: The statement â€œthe determination of the natureâ€ refers to the determination of the obtainment.

original: rtogs pa'i don lan du bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½snga ma gang yin de nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don lan du bstan pa ni / snga ma gang yin de nyid do //
translated: The reply to the meaning of the understanding is

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the statement â€œit is just that which was before.â€

original: rang gi ngo bo snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo snang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: The answer is: â€œbecause of the appearance of its own nature.â€

original: gzhan la yang ste rnam pa gcod pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ste rnam pa gcod pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The objection is: â€œBut also in the case of the exclusion of other.â€

original: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The answer is: â€œIn that case, etc.â€

original: rtag pa ni skad cig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni skad cig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The permanent is not momentary.

original: rtag tu ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni thams cad du'o //
translated: Always means: at all times.

original: shes bya bzhin du rang nyid kyis brjod par shes pa'i rtag pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shes bya bzhin du rang nyid kyis brjod par shes pa'i rtag pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te //
translated: It is not taught that the permanent is the nature of the cognition of itself, as is the object of cognition.

original: rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is: â€œbecause of permanence.â€

original: mngon sum las gzhan pa sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa de yan tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin de /
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan pa sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa de yan tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin de /
translated: It is not taught that the recognition of what was seen before, which is different from perception, is not a means of valid cognition.

original: yid ces pa me pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½mngon @93a * //
analyzed: yid ces pa me pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // mngon @93a * //
translated: The reason is: â€œbecause of the mind.â€

original: sum gzhan yang snga ma nyid bzhin du rtog pa ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sum gzhan yang snga ma nyid bzhin du rtog pa ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not taught that another perception is not a conception, just like the former one.

original: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is: â€œbecause of the other.â€

original: phyi ma de phyi ma'i dus su ji ltar dngos po rig pa de bzhin du sngar yang yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma de phyi ma'i dus su ji ltar dngos po rig pa de bzhin du sngar yang yin te /
translated: Just as it is later, when the thing is perceived, so it was earlier,

original: de'i ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because there is no difference in its nature.

original: dngos po de las skyes pa'i blo yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po de las skyes pa'i blo yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from that thing is also like that.

original: gang gi tshe gcig byung ba de nyid kyi tshe blo gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig byung ba de nyid kyi tshe blo gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
translated: When one cognition occurs, at that time another cognition also exists,

original: yod pa 'dzin pa nyid ni gzhan med pa'i phyir te ji ltar gcig pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa 'dzin pa nyid ni gzhan med pa'i phyir te ji ltar gcig pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the apprehension of existence itself is not different. The meaning is that just as one exists, so also another exists.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas cung zad ji ltar yang 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems pa la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas cung zad ji ltar yang 'dzin pa yin no snyam du sems pa la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one thinks that it is apprehended in some way in dependence on place, time, and so on, the other is said to be the object,

original: yul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo bsdus pa'i rtag pa shes pa thams cad kyis kyang yod pa ji lta ba kho na bzhin du 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa rnams kyis 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo bsdus pa'i rtag pa shes pa thams cad kyis kyang yod pa ji lta ba kho na bzhin du 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the effect is the nature of the object, and the permanent is the collection of all cognitions. The meaning is that it is apprehended just as it exists.

original: de la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: â€œIn dependence onâ€ means in dependence on the object, etc.

original: dus gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: â€œAt the same timeâ€ is a particular action of cognition.

original: de 'di ltar yid kyi khas blangs nas de bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yid kyi khas blangs nas de bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, having accepted the mind, he teaches it.

original: da ni de nyid med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de nyid med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach that it does not exist, he says:

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe aspect of experienceâ€ is the object of memory.

original: dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas yid kyi yod par gyur pa yin par rtogs so snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas yid kyi yod par gyur pa yin par rtogs so snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the existence of the mind is understood because memory is not tenable without it, he says:

original: gal te yid kyi ma dmigs na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi ma dmigs na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf the mind is not apprehendedâ€

original: 'di skad du //
analyzed: 'di skad du //
translated: This is what is said:

original: rna bas 'dzin pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: rna bas 'dzin pa'i dus na ni /
translated: When sound is apprehended by the ear,

original: gal te de yid mi 'dzin na //
analyzed: gal te de yid mi 'dzin na //
translated: if the mind does not apprehend it,

original: 'on bas sgra ni dran mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on bas sgra ni dran mi 'gyur //
translated: then sound will not be remembered.

original: dran pa tham cad 'byung mi 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes grags pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa tham cad 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes grags pa'o //
translated: All memory will not occur.

original: dran par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: dran par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: â€œIt will not be rememberedâ€ means by the mind.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bcas pa dang yid dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bcas pa dang yid dag gi'o //
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to the mind and the mental factors.

original: rnam shes nyid ni dbang po'i rnam shes dang yid dag la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam shes nyid ni dbang po'i rnam shes dang yid dag la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: Consciousness itself is also similar to the sense consciousnesses and the mental consciousness.

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because it is a consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam shes kyi yul lam gzhan yang 'dzin na yid kyi ni gzung ba la 'dzin pa nyid yin pa dang / long ba la sogs pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam shes kyi yul lam gzhan yang 'dzin na yid kyi ni gzung ba la 'dzin pa nyid yin pa dang / long ba la sogs pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the object of the sense consciousnesses is also apprehended by the mental consciousness, and because the blind and so on do not exist,

original: ser po'i rnam par shes zhes bya ba la de ma thag pas te bar med pa'i rkyen yin gyi dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ser po'i rnam par shes zhes bya ba la de ma thag pas te bar med pa'i rkyen yin gyi dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: the mental consciousness is the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousnesses, but it is not their object.

original: @93b des na dbang po'i shes pas dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: @93b des na dbang po'i shes pas dmigs pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of the yogi that arises from the object of the sense consciousness is refuted.

original: de las byung ba can ni de las byung ba gang gi yin pa de'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba can ni de las byung ba gang gi yin pa de'o //
translated: That which arises from that is the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir 'dis long ba la sogs pa med pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis long ba la sogs pa med pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this clarifies that the blind and so on do not exist.

original: gzhan nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs /
translated: The mental consciousness is different from the sense consciousnesses, and it is simultaneous with them.

original: de'i yul gyi skad cig mas bskyed pa'i skad cig ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi skad cig mas bskyed pa'i skad cig ma gzhan yin no //
translated: It is a moment produced by the moment of the object.

original: 'dis ba lang 'dzin pa nyid kyang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ba lang 'dzin pa nyid kyang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the apprehension of the cow.

original: ji srid dbang po'i bya ba yod pa de srid du dbang po'i shes pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ji srid dbang po'i bya ba yod pa de srid du dbang po'i shes pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: As long as there is the activity of the sense faculty, it is the sense consciousness.

original: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is called the sense consciousness,

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog ba med pa'o //
translated: the other is non-conceptual.

original: dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ni 'di'i zhes sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa ni 'di'i zhes sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the object that is not compatible with the characteristics of the sense faculty is this and so on.

original: shes pa de'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi mthun par bstan pa ni goms pa las bya ba'o //ğŸ”½mngon sum nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa de'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi mthun par bstan pa ni goms pa las bya ba'o // mngon sum nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reason that is not compatible with that consciousness is from habituation.

original: mdun du gnas pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdun du gnas pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the reason for being a direct perception is in front.

original: dbang po'i byed pa yod kyang de'i 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa la goms pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa yod kyang de'i 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa la goms pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: ma yin te mig gi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te mig gi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: No, because the eye consciousness is not the cause of the adherence to external objects.

original: mos pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Adherence is the grasping of external objects.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni 'jug pa'i yul mthong bas 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni 'jug pa'i yul mthong bas 'jug par byed la /
translated: The sense consciousness engages by seeing the engaged object.

original: phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa ni zhen pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa ni zhen pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The grasping of external objects is by way of attachment.

original: 'di zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa'i 'og tu yid kyi yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'o // gang gi tshe dbang po'i shes pa'i 'og tu yid kyi yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is taught by â€œby this.â€

original: dbang po'i shes pa gzhan yang yin pa'i phyir dus mtshungs par mngon par zhen pa dang cig shos rnam pa gnyi ga dmigs pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa gzhan yang yin pa'i phyir dus mtshungs par mngon par zhen pa dang cig shos rnam pa gnyi ga dmigs pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: When the mental consciousness is after the sense consciousness, then the sense consciousness is also another. Therefore, is it not the case that both the attachment and the other are observed at the same time?

original: 'o na dus gcig tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na dus gcig tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is:ğŸ”½â€œIf they were simultaneousâ€¦â€

original: rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa yin yang dus gcig tu mngon par rlom pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa yin yang dus gcig tu mngon par rlom pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The two aspects are different, but they are the object of the conceit of oneness.

original: rab rib can gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by â€œtwo people with eye disease.â€

original: de'i phyir 'dis dbang po las skyes pa yul thob pa'i bar du ni yid kyi nus pa nyid kyis yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis dbang po las skyes pa yul thob pa'i bar du ni yid kyi nus pa nyid kyis yin la /
translated: Therefore, this shows that the arising of the sense consciousnesses up to the attainment of the object is due to the power of the mind.

original: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa gnyi pa bzhin du rtogs pa'i don can ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa gnyi pa bzhin du rtogs pa'i don can ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like the two sense consciousnesses, it is not the case that the mind has the meaning of realization.

original: gal te goms pa'i bskyed bya yid kyi mngon par zhen pa yin la /ğŸ”½goms pa'i bskyed bya bde ba la @94a * //
analyzed: gal te goms pa'i bskyed bya yid kyi mngon par zhen pa yin la / goms pa'i bskyed bya bde ba la @94a * //
translated: If the object of the conceit of the mind is that which is produced by habituation,ğŸ”½then pleasure and so on, which are also produced by habituation, would be the mind, because you accept that habituation is the mind.

original: sogs pa yang yid kyi bar 'gyur te goms pa yid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa yang yid kyi bar 'gyur te goms pa yid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by â€œpleasure and so on.â€

original: dbang po'i rnam shes kyi de ma thag las byung ba'i rkyen las byung ba can bzhin du de dag la yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam shes kyi de ma thag las byung ba'i rkyen las byung ba can bzhin du de dag la yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: They are taught to exist in the same way that they arise from the condition of the immediately preceding sense consciousness.

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called â€œthe apprehension of the aspect that is present before one. â€

original: dbang po las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa'o //
translated: â€œArisen from the sense facultyâ€ means produced from the sense faculty.

original: rtsa ba dang 'gal ba'i bshad pa gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'gal ba'i bshad pa gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The argument that the explanation of the root text is to be understood in a different way is presented in the following

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The words â€œpleasure, etc.â€

original: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa ni tsha ba dang zhim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa ni tsha ba dang zhim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Pleasure and pain are the causes of pleasure and pain because they have the nature of heat and cold, etc.

original: dbang po las byung bar ji ltar smra ba yin zhe na rnam par mi rtog kyang snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las byung bar ji ltar smra ba yin zhe na rnam par mi rtog kyang snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can it be said that they arise from the sense faculty? Even though they are not conceptual, they are called â€œappearances. â€

original: de skad brjod pa ni dbang po las byung ba zhes bya bar nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad brjod pa ni dbang po las byung ba zhes bya bar nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The words â€œin this wayâ€ refer to the designation â€œarisen from the sense faculty. â€

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la 'dzin pa ste sna tshogs pa nyid la goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs kyi rnam pa la 'dzin pa ste sna tshogs pa nyid la goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThe apprehension of a different aspectâ€ is the apprehension of a variety of aspects because of the cultivation of variety.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi rgyu la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi rgyu la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: â€œIn that very same wayâ€ means that there is no difference in the cause of the apprehension of various aspects.

original: dbang po'i shes pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the case of the sense consciousnessesâ€ shows that.

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar goms pa'o//
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar goms pa'o//
translated: â€œIf that is soâ€ means â€œif it is as I have explained.â€

original: sna tshogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis yid kyi byed pa nyid du zhen par rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis yid kyi byed pa nyid du zhen par rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The idea is that the mind is conceived to be the agent of consciousness of various objects.

original: yid nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yid nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: â€œThe mind itself is not.â€ğŸ”½The idea is that if the product of the habitual mind were a direct perception of the mind, it would be like saying â€œthisâ€ and then saying â€œthat.â€

original: goms pa'i yid kyi bskyed bya yid kyi mngon sum nyid yin na 'di'o zhes bya ba bzhin du de'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro snyam du sem pa ni 'on yid kyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i yid kyi bskyed bya yid kyi mngon sum nyid yin na 'di'o zhes bya ba bzhin du de'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro snyam du sem pa ni 'on yid kyi shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œBut the mind consciousnessâ€ is the idea that the mind consciousness is the direct perception of the mind that is the product of the habitual mind.

original: ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa tham cad don gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa de bzhin du yid kyi yin par bstan pa ni rang gi don rjes su 'gro ba'i don gang gi rgyu yin pa de yang 'di yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa tham cad don gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa de bzhin du yid kyi yin par bstan pa ni rang gi don rjes su 'gro ba'i don gang gi rgyu yin pa de yang 'di yin la /
translated: That which is the cause of the object that is concomitant with its own object is also this,

original: don yang yin pa de la ltos pa'i phyir de la ltos pa can te dbang skyes blo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don yang yin pa de la ltos pa'i phyir de la ltos pa can te dbang skyes blo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and because it depends on the object, it is dependent on that. It is connected with the phrase â€œthe cognition arisen from the sense faculties.â€

original: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t analysis conceptual?

original: ji ltar mngon sum yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How can it be direct perception?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gsal bas mtshon pas mngon sum yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i chas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½rgyu dbang po'i shes pa ni @94b yid kyi dang dus mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gsal bas mtshon pas mngon sum yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i chas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // rgyu dbang po'i shes pa ni @94b yid kyi dang dus mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is taught that it is direct perception because it is characterized by clear appearance, but it is not direct perception in the sense of being conceptual.ğŸ”½The cause, the sense consciousness, is not simultaneous with the mental consciousness.

original: dus tha dad pa'i yang yid kyi yul lhan cig byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i yang yid kyi yul lhan cig byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the object of the mental consciousness, which is of a different time, a simultaneous cause.

original: yid kyi dus su yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi dus su yul yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The mind thinks that at the time of the mental faculty, it is the object.

original: gal te yid kyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the mental consciousness also is the agent of arising,

original: rgol ba 'di rjod par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa ni rang shes dus can ni yid kyi dang dus mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba 'di rjod par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan pa ni rang shes dus can ni yid kyi dang dus mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The verse that teaches the opponentâ€™s statement is â€œIf the mental consciousness also is the agent of arising.â€

original: 'bras bu las snga rol na med pa nyid yin pas khyab pa 'byung bar byed po nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu las snga rol na med pa nyid yin pas khyab pa 'byung bar byed po nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it does not exist prior to the effect, the pervasion that the agent of arising is the cause is contradictory.

original: med par sngar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med par sngar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse that teaches this is â€œIf it does not exist prior to the effect.â€ğŸ”½Since the existence of the effect or the pervasion that it exists is the agent of arising, the pervasion is contradictory.

original: 'bras bu'i yod pa nyid dam yod pas khyab pa 'byung bar byed pa po nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½snga na yod pa la ni 'byung bar byed pa po nyid 'bras bu las sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yod pa nyid dam yod pas khyab pa 'byung bar byed pa po nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba'o // snga na yod pa la ni 'byung bar byed pa po nyid 'bras bu las sam /
translated: The verse that teaches this is â€œIf it exists later.â€

original: rgyu las khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu las khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: If it exists prior to the effect, the agent of arising is not contradictory with the pervasion that it is the cause of the effect.

original: yod pa dang med dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa dang med dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Since existence and nonexistence are not established, the verse that teaches this is â€œIf it exists prior to the effect.â€

original: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½rang blo ste yid kyi dang lhan cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin // zhes bya ba'o // rang blo ste yid kyi dang lhan cig pa ma yin te /
translated: All causes exist prior to their effects.ğŸ”½The object is not simultaneous with the mental cognition, but rather with the sense perception.

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'dzin pa'i byed pas khyab pa'i gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus nyid na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i byed pas khyab pa'i gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus nyid na ma yin nam /
translated: The object is pervaded by the act of apprehension. Is it not the case that the object is apprehended at the time of the apprehension?

original: dus gzhan nyid ni snang ba nye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan nyid ni snang ba nye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that the object should appear at another time.

original: dus gzhan yang khyab bya yin no zhes bya ba yang gtam tsam yin te de nye ba nyid rang gi ngo bo nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan yang khyab bya yin no zhes bya ba yang gtam tsam yin te de nye ba nyid rang gi ngo bo nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that the object is pervaded by another time is mere verbiage, because the object itself is present.

original: 'di la lar khyab pa med pa ji ltar yin zhe na 'di de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la lar khyab pa med pa ji ltar yin zhe na 'di de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can there be nonpervasion here? Because it does not exist at that time.

original: snang ba'i dus na ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i dus na ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is present only at the time of the appearance of the object.

original: snang ba yod par brjod pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba yod par brjod pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the object is pervaded by another time is mere verbiage, because the object itself is present.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed bya nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid ma yin pa la mi 'jug na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed bya nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid ma yin pa la mi 'jug na /
translated: The experience of the effect, such as the sense faculty, does not occur in what is not the self.

original: dmigs par byed pa ma yin la 'jug na yang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin te de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa ma yin la 'jug na yang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin te de las skyes pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: If it does occur, then it is just the self, because it is produced from it. It is the apprehender.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu nyid gzung ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni gzung bar shes zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½snang ba'i ngo bor yang gzung bya nyid ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyis khyab par ni tha dad pa yin la 'gal ba khyab pa yin zhes zer ba 'di snang ba yang @95a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu nyid gzung ba nyid yin par bstan pa ni gzung bar shes zhes bya ba'o // snang ba'i ngo bor yang gzung bya nyid ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyis khyab par ni tha dad pa yin la 'gal ba khyab pa yin zhes zer ba 'di snang ba yang @95a * //
translated: The demonstration that such a cause is the object of apprehension is â€œthe object of consciousness.â€

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object of apprehension is also the appearance, because the simultaneity of the object of apprehension with consciousness is pervaded by difference, and the pervasion by contradiction is stated in â€œthe appearance.â€

original: 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni grub mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni grub mtha'o //
translated: What is this? This is the conclusion.

original: shes pa yod na gang snang bde nyid sngar mi snang ba'i ngo bo gzhan skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yod na gang snang bde nyid sngar mi snang ba'i ngo bo gzhan skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When consciousness exists, the appearance is just that. It is not the production of another nature that did not appear previously.

original: de lta na yang shes pa'i nus pa yod do snyam du sems pa ni shes pas kyang de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang shes pa'i nus pa yod do snyam du sems pa ni shes pas kyang de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that the capacity of consciousness exists, then that is the same as consciousness.

original: 'on te shes pa yod na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te shes pa yod na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: If there is consciousness, then that is the forward pervasion.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: If not, then it is the reverse pervasion.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid 'bras bu yin te mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni dus mnyam nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid 'bras bu yin te mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni dus mnyam nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the simultaneity of the two is the effect because it is seen, then that is the same as saying that simultaneity is seen.

original: mig la sogs pa'i byed pa tha dad pa can shes pa dag nyid kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½de lta'o na ni zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i byed pa tha dad pa can shes pa dag nyid kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / de lta'o na ni zhes pa ste /
translated: The difference in the function of the eye, etc., is not observed in consciousness itself.

original: bdag go zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang lus dang dbang po dang bde ba la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang lus dang dbang po dang bde ba la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that is so, then the thought â€œI amâ€ is also the observation of the body, the faculties, pleasure, etc.ğŸ”½The meaning is that it is not the nature of the object.

original: don gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gang yod na ni zhes bya ba ste don la'o //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa ni gang yod na ni zhes bya ba ste don la'o //
translated: The explanation of â€œnot the nature of the objectâ€ is â€œif it exists.â€

original: gang zhes bya ba ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni snang ba'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the appearance.

original: skye zhing zhes bya ba ni phyis yin gyi lhan cig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye zhing zhes bya ba ni phyis yin gyi lhan cig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œArisesâ€ means later, not simultaneously.

original: zhig pa yang lhan cig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhig pa yang lhan cig pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The refutation of simultaneity is:

original: gnas pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œWhile it is enduring.â€ğŸ”½The refutation of the difference of arising and destruction is:

original: lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: â€œSince they are not seen to be different.â€

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponentâ€™s objection is stated in the verse:ğŸ”½â€œIf it is because of the difference of the object . . . â€ The meaning is that the difference of the appearance of the object is like the difference of the reflection and the blue.

original: gal te yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyid ni rgol ba yin te yul gyi snang ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis bzhin las gzugs brnyan dang / sngon po las snang ba'i'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa nyid ni rgol ba yin te yul gyi snang ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis bzhin las gzugs brnyan dang / sngon po las snang ba'i'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The response to the objection is:

original: snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po nyid yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi sngon po nyid yin te /
translated: â€œThe appearance is the nature of the blue.â€

original: yul snang ba'i dbye ba la tha dad pa'i sgrub byed med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul snang ba'i dbye ba la tha dad pa'i sgrub byed med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because there is no proof of a difference in the appearance of objects.

original: ji ltar mig las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is demonstrated by the line, â€œHow can the eye . . . â€

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin par sngar khas blangs pas gtan tshigs grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa mi snang ba'i bdag nyid yin par sngar khas blangs pas gtan tshigs grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it was previously accepted that the nature of the appearance of blue, etc., is the eye, etc., the reason is established. This is demonstrated by the line,

original: ji ltar mig la sogs rnams las //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs rnams las // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œHow can the eye . . . â€

original: de bzhin du ste don bzhin du snang ba mi srid par snga rol du mig la sogs pa rnams las ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ste don bzhin du snang ba mi srid par snga rol du mig la sogs pa rnams las ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œJust soâ€ means that it is impossible for the eye, etc., to appear in accordance with the object prior to the eye, etc.

original: dbang po'i rnam shes @95b dang dus mtshungs pas dbang po'i rnam shes kyi yul gyi bskyed bya'i don gyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par bskyed pas skyed byed ma yin pa gzhan mi 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam shes @95b dang dus mtshungs pas dbang po'i rnam shes kyi yul gyi bskyed bya'i don gyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par bskyed pas skyed byed ma yin pa gzhan mi 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t it the case that the object that is the cause of the production of the object that is the object of the eye consciousness is not apprehended as something other than that which produces the form of the objectâ€™s own nature that is produced by the eye consciousness that is simultaneous with it?

original: de 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How is it that it is called â€œapprehendingâ€?

original: rgyu du ma nyid yod na yang bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu du ma nyid yod na yang bya ba smos te /
translated: Even though there are many causes, the action is mentioned.

original: rang gi rnam pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid kho na gzung ba nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid kho na gzung ba nyid yin zhing /
translated: It is just the production of consciousness in its aspect that is apprehending,

original: de sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kho na 'dzin pa nyid ni gtso bo yin te gzhan mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kho na 'dzin pa nyid ni gtso bo yin te gzhan mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the aspect that is superimposed is just the apprehending that is primary, because it is not seen otherwise.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'brel pa can byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'brel pa can byed pa'o //
translated: The result is the related action that will be explained.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa'i bya ba las so //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa'i bya ba las so //
translated: That which is the action that is performed is the object of the name.

original: rgyu de yang 'bras bu de la de lta bur ngo bo gang gis de lta bu'i yin pa des 'bras bus 'dzin pa yin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu de yang 'bras bu de la de lta bur ngo bo gang gis de lta bu'i yin pa des 'bras bus 'dzin pa yin zhes brjod do //
translated: That cause is the result, and it is the apprehender in that way, by the nature that is such.

original: 'di nyid gtso bo 'dzin byed la sogs pa ming gi brda'i yul yin gyi phal pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gtso bo 'dzin byed la sogs pa ming gi brda'i yul yin gyi phal pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the primary apprehender, etc., and is the object of the name, but not the ordinary.

original: phyed snga mas ni 'dzin byed kyi ming gi yul dang / phyed phyi mas ni gzung bya'i ming gi yul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyed snga mas ni 'dzin byed kyi ming gi yul dang / phyed phyi mas ni gzung bya'i ming gi yul bstan pa yin no //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the objective support of the apprehending subject, and the second half shows the objective support of the apprehended object.

original: 'bras bu de'i ni rgyu de dang de'i ngo bo zhes brjod de de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'dzin byed kyang yin la rgyu de 'bras bu des bzung ba yin no zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i ni rgyu de dang de'i ngo bo zhes brjod de de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'dzin byed kyang yin la rgyu de 'bras bu des bzung ba yin no zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: The cause of that effect is called its nature, because it is connected with it. The apprehending subject is also that cause, and that effect is apprehended by that cause.

original: gzhan dag ni kun du 'khor bas gzung byar nye bar btags pas bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni kun du 'khor bas gzung byar nye bar btags pas bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the objective support is taught as being figuratively designated as the apprehended object because of the complete revolution.

original: bde ba dang sdug pa bsngal rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bsdu bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug pa bsngal rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo bsdu bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The words â€œin regard to pleasure and pain, etc.â€ indicate the inclusion of the essential nature of conceptual differentiation.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words â€œof all mind and mental factorsâ€ are stated.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not apprehended as having the nature of attachment, aversion, etc.,

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsten pa ni /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsten pa ni /
translated: because it is not clearly evident. This is the explanation.

original: bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œHappiness, etc.â€

original: shes pa gzhan ni gzhan la gzhan dang sbyor bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ni yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan ni gzhan la gzhan dang sbyor bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ni yin no //
translated: Other cognitions are connected with other things, not with non-other things.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mngon sum gyi ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mngon sum gyi ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And the nature of direct perception is not other than happiness, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum nyid de las gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum nyid de las gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because direct perception is not other than that.

original: gzhan mi rten ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mi rten ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyi yul ma yin no //
translated: â€œNot dependent on anotherâ€ means not the object of another apprehender.

original: gzhan gyi yul nyid yin pa las byung ba brda'i yul nyid la des khyab pa la yul gzhan nyid ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ste /ğŸ”½rnam par rtog @96a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul nyid yin pa las byung ba brda'i yul nyid la des khyab pa la yul gzhan nyid ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ste / rnam par rtog @96a * //
translated: The arising from being the object of another, being the object of a conventional symbol, is pervaded by that. Being the object of another is the contradictory pervasion.

original: pa can nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni brda byed par ni nus ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa can nyid la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni brda byed par ni nus ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The contradiction of the pervasion in the case of the conceptual is shown by â€œone cannot make a conventional symbol for it.â€

original: rang rig ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang rig ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Self-awareness is not hidden.

original: brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: â€œExpressionâ€ is that which expresses.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni 'dres pa yin la /
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni 'dres pa yin la /
translated: And that which is related to it is mixed with it.

original: de dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste rang gi yul gyi bdag nyid ni brda la rung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ma yin pa ste rang gi yul gyi bdag nyid ni brda la rung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: And that which is not endowed with it, that is, which is not of the nature of its object, is not fit for a sign.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not fit to be a means of knowledge.

original: de la ma rtogs pa de rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ma rtogs pa de rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the reason there, it is because it is not known. The meaning is: because it is of the nature of a logical reason.

original: bdag gi bde ba rig go zhes tha dad par 'dzin pa ni bde ba mngon sum gyi phyis kyi rtog pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni snga ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba rig go zhes tha dad par 'dzin pa ni bde ba mngon sum gyi phyis kyi rtog pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni snga ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of the difference, â€œI know my pleasure,â€ is shown to be just a subsequent conception after the direct perception of pleasure: â€œthe nature of the prior, etc.â€

original: dran pas rig pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bde ba rig go zhes rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dran pas rig pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bde ba rig go zhes rtogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œKnowledge by memoryâ€ refers to the conception, â€œI know my pleasure.â€

original: de'i tshe nyid na skyes pa ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid na skyes pa ni byung ba'o //
translated: â€œArisen at that timeâ€ means occurred.

original: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi'o //
translated: â€œAbiding in thatâ€ refers to the direct perception.

original: yid kyi bde ba yid kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin yang mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: yid kyi bde ba yid kyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin yang mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: Mental pleasure is the form and sound, etc. of the mental sense-faculty. But is it not unclear?

original: de kho na la ji ltar ma 'brel ba yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de kho na la ji ltar ma 'brel ba yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How can it be unrelated to that?

original: yid kyi'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse says, â€œMental pleasure is also like that.â€

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las 'ongs pa yang yid las byung ba rang bdag nyid ni yid kho na la gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las 'ongs pa yang yid las byung ba rang bdag nyid ni yid kho na la gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The mental sense-faculty does not arise from the latent impressions of experience, and its own nature does not reside in the mental sense-faculty itself.

original: don la yang ni phyi rol rnams la ste de las sbyor bas don la rnam par rtog pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don la yang ni phyi rol rnams la ste de las sbyor bas don la rnam par rtog pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is also in the external objects, because it is connected with them. Thus, it is conceptual with regard to objects.

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni de rtog pa can ma yin te /ğŸ”½gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni de rtog pa can ma yin te / gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is not conceptual with regard to its own nature, which is not hidden.

original: skye ba de tshe nyid yod phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba de tshe nyid yod phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse says, â€œBecause the object exists at the time of its production.â€

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not hidden, because it is produced.

original: gal te don ni 'dzin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te don ni 'dzin gyur na //
translated: If the object were grasped,

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di la don gyi rnam pa can 'dzin pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di la don gyi rnam pa can 'dzin pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is saying that if this is the apprehension of the aspect of the object, then...

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa la yang ngo //
translated: Also there means also in the superimposition.

original: 'dzin dang sgro 'dogs yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin dang sgro 'dogs yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is apprehension and superimposition,

original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang sgro 'dogs pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang sgro 'dogs pa dag gi'o //
translated: means of seeing and superimposition.ğŸ”½If they are made one,

original: gcig tu byed na ni ste snang du rung ba dang brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed na ni'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byed na ni ste snang du rung ba dang brtag par bya ba gcig tu byed na ni'o //
translated: if they are made one in being suitable to appear and to be investigated,ğŸ”½those

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang sgro btags pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang sgro btags pa dag gi'o //
translated: means the apprehension and the superimposition.

original: rtog pa can ma yin pa'i gcig po ma bzung ba la 'jug par byed pa ji @96b lta ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog par mngon par 'dod pa yang yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med par yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa can ma yin pa'i gcig po ma bzung ba la 'jug par byed pa ji @96b lta ba de bzhin du rnam par rtog par mngon par 'dod pa yang yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med par yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as the non-conceptual one is engaged in the non-apprehended, in the same way, it is also asserted to be a conception.

original: 'o na da ni shes pa kun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na da ni shes pa kun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is non-conceptual, it says, Well then now, all consciousnesses...

original: mngon du mi byed pa'i shes pa 'jug par byed pa rnam par rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon du mi byed pa'i shes pa 'jug par byed pa rnam par rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the consciousness that does not manifest is engaged by conception, it says, ...are not engaged by the object.

original: mngon du byed pa ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œnot manifestâ€ is said.

original: de las gzhan pa rtogs pa med pa'i mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rtogs pa med pa'i mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The other, which is not a realization, is taught to be perception:

original: gang la mthong bar mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang la mthong bar mngon 'dod pa //
translated: â€œwhere there is a desire to seeâ€

original: zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos kyi rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos kyi rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: is said.ğŸ”½The distinction between the nature of conceptual and non-conceptual is taught:

original: mngon sum dbye ba bstan pa ni /
