analyzed: mngon sum dbye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the distinction of perception:

original: bag chags stobs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags stobs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œfrom the power of habitual tendenciesâ€ is said.

original: gang la mthong bar mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang la mthong bar mngon 'dod pa //
translated: â€œwhere there is a desire to seeâ€

original: zhes bya ba'i rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bde ba la sogs pa rig pa la yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bde ba la sogs pa rig pa la yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: is said. The characteristic of non-conceptual awareness, which is the existence of the awareness of pleasure, etc., is taught:

original: bde sogs rnams kyi rang bzhin la //
analyzed: bde sogs rnams kyi rang bzhin la //
translated: â€œthe nature of pleasure, etc.â€

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is said.ğŸ”½â€œThere is no object of thatâ€ is said.

original: de la las dang byed pa yis //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni de rig pa'i gzung bya ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la las dang byed pa yis // zhes bya ba ni de rig pa'i gzung bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: â€œBy action and by doingâ€ is said.ğŸ”½â€œBy actionâ€ is not the object of awareness.

original: byed pa yis zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjod byed nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa yis zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjod byed nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: â€œBy doingâ€ is not the nature of the expression of awareness.

original: de 'di ltar don nam bde ba la sogs pa mngon du byed pa la rig pa ni dbang po la mi ltos pa'i yid tsam las byung ba nyid kyis yid kyi mngon sum yin par slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'di ltar don nam bde ba la sogs pa mngon du byed pa la rig pa ni dbang po la mi ltos pa'i yid tsam las byung ba nyid kyis yid kyi mngon sum yin par slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master says that this is mental direct perception, because it arises from the mere mind that does not rely on the sense faculties.

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pas ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhes bya bas yid kyi khyad par can nyid du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pas ni rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa can dbang po'i shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa zhes bya bas yid kyi khyad par can nyid du bstan pa yin la /
translated: The author of the PramaÌ„nï¬ avaÌ„rtika says that it is a special mental direct perception, because it is produced by the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousness that has as its object the object that is its own object and that has a simultaneous cause.

original: de yang bde ba la sogs pa rig pa la mi srid do snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de yang bde ba la sogs pa rig pa la mi srid do snyam du sems pa la /
translated: He thinks that it is impossible for the awareness of pleasure, etc. to be like this.

original: rnam pa 'ga' yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to show that it is possible, he says,

original: 'di la yid mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yid mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called mental direct perception.

original: 'di la yang bde ba 'dzin pa dang po'i rang gi yul nyid lhan cig byed pa can ni de ma thag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang bde ba 'dzin pa dang po'i rang gi yul nyid lhan cig byed pa can ni de ma thag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: In this case, the simultaneous cause of the apprehension of pleasure is not the immediately preceding condition, because it is not a different time.

original: dus tha dad pa min na de ma thag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa min na de ma thag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not a different time, it would be the immediately preceding condition.

original: dbang po'i shes pas zhes bya ba yang shes pa snga ma nye bar mtshon pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas zhes bya ba yang shes pa snga ma nye bar mtshon pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase â€œby the sensory consciousnessâ€ also indicates the prior cognition.

original: don dang bde sogs rang bzhin la //
analyzed: don dang bde sogs rang bzhin la //
translated: The line â€œthe object, pleasure, etc.,ğŸ”½is the nature of the cognitionâ€

original: zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½'gyur ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rtog pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // 'gyur ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rtog pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is the explanation.

original: 'khrul pas dbye ba mi rtogs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pas dbye ba mi rtogs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase â€œthe differenceâ€ is to be supplied with the phrase â€œis not understood because of the error.â€

original: rab rib can gnyis @97a * //
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis @97a * //
translated: The line â€œthe two people with diseased visionâ€

original: kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the explanation.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pas so //
translated: The phrase â€œin that wayâ€ refers to the difference.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis su mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis su mthong ba la'o //
translated: The phrase â€œin that caseâ€ refers to the perception of two moons.

original: ji ltar med par gyur pa de ltar tha dad pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar med par gyur pa de ltar tha dad pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase â€œjust as it is nonexistentâ€ is to be supplied with the phrase â€œbecause of the difference.â€

original: de gcig nyid du rjes su dpog / ces bya ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba la ltos pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de gcig nyid du rjes su dpog / ces bya ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba la ltos pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: The line â€œone infers that it is oneâ€ is the summary of the argument that depends on the perception of the effect.

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis la'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthe twoâ€ refers to the two moons.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: The phrase â€œis seenâ€ refers to direct perception.

original: des ni skyes bu des so //
analyzed: des ni skyes bu des so //
translated: The phrase â€œby thatâ€ refers to the person.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum dang dbang po las skyes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mngon sum dang dbang po las skyes pa yang ngo //
translated: This is the mental perception and the one born from the sense faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid bzhin du yid kyi ni rang rig pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad las tha dad pa yin yang tha mi dad par zhen pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid bzhin du yid kyi ni rang rig pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad las tha dad pa yin yang tha mi dad par zhen pa'i yul yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Just as the cause of the eye, etc., is different from the convention of self-awareness, etc., but is the object of attachment to non-difference, it is shown:

original: de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind.

original: tha mi dad par mngon par zhen pa yin na tha snyad pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par mngon par zhen pa yin na tha snyad pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If there is attachment to non-difference, would not the conventional world of the world become non-existent?

original: 'di la tha snyad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la tha snyad ces bya ba ste /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba ni btags pa'o //
translated: Inference is also a designation.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang / bzlog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang / bzlog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a conventional that contradicts, it is possible to have the forward and reverse pervasion, etc., in one's own inference.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa dang rang rig pa yod na yod pa kho nas yid kyi mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa dang rang rig pa yod na yod pa kho nas yid kyi mngon sum yin te /
translated: Therefore, if the sense consciousness and autocognition exist, then mental direct perception exists, because it is the result of those two.

original: sems yod na 'du shes la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin du ste 'bras bu phul du byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gnad kyi don yin no //ğŸ”½rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa shes kyang rang nyid rig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems yod na 'du shes la sogs pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin du ste 'bras bu phul du byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gnad kyi don yin no // rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa shes kyang rang nyid rig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If the mind exists, then mental factors such as discrimination exist.

original: rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that the aspect of consciousness that is the nature of awareness knows itself, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni ches ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rig par byed pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni ches ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: It is not that the nature of what does not know itself is awareness.

original: gzhan yang rig byed min de dag / ces bya ba'o //ğŸ”½de dag kyang bems po'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed min de dag / ces bya ba'o // de dag kyang bems po'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, those imperceptible formsğŸ”½are the nature of matter.

original: don bzhin du mngon sum pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: don bzhin du mngon sum pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: They are direct perception, just like the object.

original: don gcig la brten zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don gcig la brten zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are based on the same object.

original: don gcig la 'du bas gnyi ga yang bdag la 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du bas gnyi ga yang bdag la 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Both are based on the same object, because both are based on the self.

original: gal te rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is because it is the object of awareness, then it is direct perception.

original: don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa ni shes pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi sngon po bzhin du bems po'i bdag @97b nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa ni shes pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi sngon po bzhin du bems po'i bdag @97b nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that unifies the single object grasps it, just as cognition itself is the nature of the cognition of pleasure, etc., and not the nature of an inert object, like blue,ğŸ”½because the collection is not different.

original: tshogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni / de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
translated: This is taught by the line:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe entity that is not that and is not not that.â€

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par 'bras bu'i 'khrul pa can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par 'bras bu'i 'khrul pa can ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the particular collection is not the cause of error in the effect is:

original: de min dngos rgyus bskyed pa ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo can rnams so //
analyzed: de min dngos rgyus bskyed pa ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo can rnams so //
translated: â€œThat which is not that is generated by a cause that is not that.â€

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained by the line: â€œBecause of the difference in cause.â€

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa la dgos pa yin gyi gnas skabs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa la dgos pa yin gyi gnas skabs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The difference in effect is for the sake of the state, but not for the state itself.

original: de'i dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa zhes bya bas dbye ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i bye brag las bde ba dang rnam shes dag gi ma grub pa nyid brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa zhes bya bas dbye ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i bye brag las bde ba dang rnam shes dag gi ma grub pa nyid brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase produced by the cause of that thing indicates that pleasure and consciousness are not established as a collection of causes that are different from each other.

original: de yang med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase that also does not exist indicates that the effect is not established.

original: de'i dngos po can zhes bya bas bsgrub bya ma grub pa'i 'bras bu nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po can zhes bya bas bsgrub bya ma grub pa'i 'bras bu nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase that which has the nature of that indicates that the effect is not established.

original: tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase that which is not different in nature indicates that the effect is not established.

original: yang na de'i dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa yin pa'i 'bras bu rgyu tsam las byung ba rnams ni de'i ngo bo can te /
analyzed: yang na de'i dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa yin pa'i 'bras bu rgyu tsam las byung ba rnams ni de'i ngo bo can te /
translated: Or, the phrase produced by the cause of that thing indicates that effects that arise from a mere cause have the nature of that cause.

original: byung ba'i ngo bo'i yod pa nyid de de dang ldan pa rnams de'i tshe nyid na yod par 'gyur du zin kyang de lta na yang shun pa dang snying po can dang / snying po med pa'i rnam par dbye bas 'bras bu na ga rang ga tshogs pa gcig las 'byung ba ni lhan cig kho na 'byung ba de bzhin du bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa yang yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: byung ba'i ngo bo'i yod pa nyid de de dang ldan pa rnams de'i tshe nyid na yod par 'gyur du zin kyang de lta na yang shun pa dang snying po can dang / snying po med pa'i rnam par dbye bas 'bras bu na ga rang ga tshogs pa gcig las 'byung ba ni lhan cig kho na 'byung ba de bzhin du bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa yang yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: Although the existence of the entity of the effect does exist at that time, it is still differentiated as having a core or not having a core, and the effect arises from a single collection of causes and conditions.

original: yang na gal te bde ba la sogs pha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te bde ba la sogs pha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if pleasure, etc.

original: rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i don du'o //
translated: â€œBy consciousnessâ€ means by the simultaneous one.

original: gang la lhan cig 'byung ba'i shes pa med pa de mi shes pa ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la lhan cig 'byung ba'i shes pa med pa de mi shes pa ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how can that which does not have a simultaneous consciousness be consciousness?

original: nye bar len pa tha dad pa yang tha mi dad pa dag gis blang bya dang blang bya ma yin ba brjod pa 'di ma yin te shun pa dang snying po dang de'i cha shas la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i rjes su
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad pa yang tha mi dad pa dag gis blang bya dang blang bya ma yin ba brjod pa 'di ma yin te shun pa dang snying po dang de'i cha shas la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i rjes su
translated: Nor is it that what is to be taken up and what is not to be taken up are stated by those who are not different from the appropriator, because if one follows the result that is different due to the distinctions of the husk, the kernel, and its parts, etc.,

original: 'brangs na / 'bras bu thams cad la khyad par med pa dang / tshogs pa'i bskyed pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brangs na / 'bras bu thams cad la khyad par med pa dang / tshogs pa'i bskyed pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par nus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that all results would be without distinction, and the distinction of the result generated by the assembly would be able.

original: khyod kyi phyogs la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya lhan cig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dmigs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i bskyed bya lhan cig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In your position also, the meaning is that the object of observation of the consciousness of pleasure, pain, etc., would be co-present with the object generated by the assembly of the eye, form, etc.

original: rgyu mtshungs @98a * //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs @98a * //
translated: The same cause

original: pa nyid ces bya ba 'di tshogs pa mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa nyid ces bya ba 'di tshogs pa mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: is the same assembly.

original: nye bar len pa mtshungs pa nyid yin na don dang bcas pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs pa'i nus pa yin par bstan pa ni 'brel pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa mtshungs pa nyid yin na don dang bcas pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshogs pa'i nus pa yin par bstan pa ni 'brel pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the appropriator were the same as the appropriated, then the statement â€œit has a purposeâ€ and so on would be meaningless.

original: 'on te de'i tshe bde ba ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe bde ba ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las gzhan pa ste /
translated: If at that time pleasure has not arisen, it is not a cause of consciousness.

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos nas bde ba skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos nas bde ba skye ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that pleasure does not arise in dependence on another cause.

original: rnam shes bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa la yang /
analyzed: rnam shes bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa la yang /
translated: Just as with consciousness, pleasure and so onğŸ”½are not seen to arise in dependence on another cause apart from the eye.

original: mig la ltos pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mig la ltos pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that there is no valid cognition in the observation or nonobservation of another cause is as follows:

original: de dag med na mi skye zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag med na mi skye zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: If they do not exist, it does not arise. This is the reverse pervasion.

original: yod na mi skye ba ma yin ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yod na mi skye ba ma yin ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: If they exist, it does not arise. This is the forward pervasion.

original: nus min zhes bya bar mtshams gcad do //
analyzed: nus min zhes bya bar mtshams gcad do //
translated: The phrase â€œit is not possibleâ€ is an interjection.

original: nus pa gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa gang la yin zhe na /
translated: What is possible?

original: 'dod pa bsgrub pa la ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub pa la ste /
translated: The establishment of desire.

original: phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa bde ba sgrub pa la ste chos la sogs pa'i shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid du nye bar 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa bde ba sgrub pa la ste chos la sogs pa'i shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid du nye bar 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The collection of pleasure, etc., is the collection of consciousnesses of Dharma, etc., which are directed toward the collection of pleasure, etc.ğŸ”½The idea that the collection of pure consciousnesses is the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., is different.ğŸ”½But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc.,

original: dag pa'i shes pa'i tshogs pa las chos la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tha dad pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /ğŸ”½'on te rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i shes pa'i tshogs pa las chos la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tha dad pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni / 'on te rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., unqualified by Dharma, etc.ğŸ”½But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc.,ğŸ”½then the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid las khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas gzhan dang gzhan thob pa yin na /ğŸ”½myu gu la sogs pa gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa bskyed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid las khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas gzhan dang gzhan thob pa yin na / myu gu la sogs pa gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa bskyed pa bzhin du /
translated: But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.,ğŸ”½then the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.ğŸ”½But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.,

original: shes pa'i tshogs pa nyid las chos la sogs pa khyad par du byed pa gzhan med na /
analyzed: shes pa'i tshogs pa nyid las chos la sogs pa khyad par du byed pa gzhan med na /
translated: then the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.ğŸ”½But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.,ğŸ”½then the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by non-Dharma, etc.ğŸ”½But if you think that the collection of consciousnesses is the cause of the collection of pleasure, etc., qualified by Dharma, etc., but not the cause of the collection of pleasure

original: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference in the result of the consciousness of pleasure and pain is taught:

original: de yang yin te gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang yin te gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is so, because...

original: 'di nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught right here:

original: de dag nyid kyi khyad par las //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi khyad par las //
translated: From the difference in those very two,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The consciousness is seen to be different.

original: kho bos ni gal te tshogs pa gcig gi bskyed bya gcig ni rnam pa gcig kho na yin na /
analyzed: kho bos ni gal te tshogs pa gcig gi bskyed bya gcig ni rnam pa gcig kho na yin na /
translated: I think that if the single product of a single collection is only one aspect,

original: gcig gi rnam pa snying po dang snying po med pa la sogs pa tha dad pa bzhin dang / 'bras bu na ga rang ga la sogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tha dad pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ngo snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa snying po dang snying po med pa la sogs pa tha dad pa bzhin dang / 'bras bu na ga rang ga la sogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tha dad pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ngo snyam du sems pa la /
translated: then just as the single aspect of essence, non-essence, and so on is different, and the result, such as a pot, is different in terms of pleasure, pain, and so on, so too is consciousness.

original: tshogs pa nyid kyi nye bar len @98b pa'i dbye bas gzhan las sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½bde sdug la sogs tha dad yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid kyi nye bar len @98b pa'i dbye bas gzhan las sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni / bde sdug la sogs tha dad yin //
translated: In order to show that the consciousness is different due to the difference in the appropriation of the collection itself,

original: zhes bya bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mthong ngo //
translated: it is said, â€œThe consciousness is seen to be different in terms of pleasure, pain, and so on.â€

original: de dang de min rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: de dang de min rang bzhin gyis //
translated: and not that nature.

analyzed: de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //

translated: The nature of that which is and is not that is the real.

original: de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
analyzed: de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
translated: The nature of that which is and is not that is the real.

original: zhes bya bas /
analyzed: zhes bya bas /

analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo ji ltar grub pa yin //

analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pa nyid las 'bras bu gcig go ngo bor 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /

analyzed: thog med goms pa'i ngo bo las //
translated: The purpose of reflexive awareness is to experience pleasure, etc., which arise from habitual tendencies, not to unite with the self.

original: zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½de ste bdag gi 'du bar mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de ste bdag gi 'du bar mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: The verse says,ğŸ”½From beginningless habituation.ğŸ”½If you do not accept that the self unites with pleasure,

original: khas mi len na bdag su'i 'brel pa can yin te /
analyzed: khas mi len na bdag su'i 'brel pa can yin te /
translated: then whose is the self?

original: bde ba bzhin du 'brel pa can mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: bde ba bzhin du 'brel pa can mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: It would not be tenable for the self to be related to pleasure.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin na mi ga las byung ba ma yin pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin na mi ga las byung ba ma yin pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i bde ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: If it is impermanent, then it is not a pleasure, etc. that is a nature that is not derived from something else, that is, it is not a nature that is directly perceived.

original: de dag tsam gyis yon tan nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tsam gyis yon tan nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it is a quality merely by being that.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to it.

original: du ba ni me med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir go bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: du ba ni me med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir go bar byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that smoke is an indicator because it does not occur if fire does not exist.

original: gal te dang po yon tan nyid //ğŸ”½ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dang po yon tan nyid // ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it were a quality at first,ğŸ”½it would not be a quality later.

original: de 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam shes las tshogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ma yin la /
analyzed: de 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam shes las tshogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the collection of consciousnesses of pleasure, etc. is not a proof of a different division.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis skye bzhin pa nyid mngon sum yin bas shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang rig pa ni grub pa yin gyi de don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas mngon sum pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis skye bzhin pa nyid mngon sum yin bas shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang rig pa ni grub pa yin gyi de don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas mngon sum pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since that which is arising through the power of meditation is directly perceived, reflexive awareness, which is the nature of consciousness, is established. But it is not directly perceived by a consciousness that is a collection of the same object.

original: skyed byed kyi @100b don tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / skyed byed ma yin pa 'dzin na yang thal ces pa'i phyir dang / tshogs pa gcig la 'brel pas kyang mig la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skyed byed kyi @100b don tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / skyed byed ma yin pa 'dzin na yang thal ces pa'i phyir dang / tshogs pa gcig la 'brel pas kyang mig la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it apprehends only the mere object that is the producer, and because it would follow, absurdly, that it would apprehend that which is not the producer, and because it would follow, absurdly, that the eye and so on would be related to the collection.

original: don gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is taught by the words â€œthe object.â€

original: nye bas ni tshogs par gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bas ni tshogs par gtogs pa ste /
translated: â€œBy proximityâ€ means by being part of the collection.

original: rgyu ma yin na yul ma yin par ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin na yul ma yin par ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is reasonable that if it is not the cause, it is not the object.

original: gzugs nyid la zhugs pa ni bye dpa po mig ni las bde ba 'dzin par bye dpa'i shes pa la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs nyid la zhugs pa ni bye dpa po mig ni las bde ba 'dzin par bye dpa'i shes pa la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The eye, which is engaged with form, is engaged in the consciousness that apprehends the object that is its effect.

original: du ba la 'jug pa'i mig nyid me la shes pa bskyed pa'i don yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: du ba la 'jug pa'i mig nyid me la shes pa bskyed pa'i don yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The eye that is engaged with smoke is the cause of the production of the consciousness of fire.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œinferenceâ€ is the same.

original: 'on te gzung ba'i rnam pa las //
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba'i rnam pa las //
translated: If it is from the aspect of the object that is apprehended,

original: zhes bya ba nas ci ste mi rtag na zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas ci ste mi rtag na zhes bya ba'i bar du rgol ba yin no //
translated: This is the argument from â€œIf it is permanentâ€ up to â€œIf it is impermanent.â€

original: bde ba'i rnam par nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du logs na gnas pa nyid kyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa kho na bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i snga na yod pa la rjes su dpag pa yin na ni phyi rol gyi nye bar gzhag pha bsgrub pa la de las bzlog pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar gzhag
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam par nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du logs na gnas pa nyid kyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa kho na bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i snga na yod pa la rjes su dpag pa yin na ni phyi rol gyi nye bar gzhag pha bsgrub pa la de las bzlog pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar gzhag
translated: â€œOnly in the aspect of pleasureâ€ means that it is not reasonable for it to exist separately, like form and so on.ğŸ”½â€œMoreoverâ€ means that if it exists prior to the arising of consciousness, like blue and so on, it is inferred.

original: pa sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa sgrub par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The statement that it is contradictory to establish the external object and to establish the latent impressions that are the opposite of that is not correct.

original: phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The external object is not established.

original: don de nyid las byung ba'i dbang po'i blos 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don de nyid las byung ba'i dbang po'i blos 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not apprehended by the sense consciousness that arises from that object?

original: bde ba ni bdag dang yid phrad pa las byung bas so snyam du sems pa la rim gyis byung ba'i shes pa gnyis rim gyis rang gi yul la snang bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bde ba ni bdag dang yid phrad pa las byung bas so snyam du sems pa la rim gyis byung ba'i shes pa gnyis rim gyis rang gi yul la snang bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The two cognitions that arise in sequence do not illuminate their objects in sequence.

original: sngon po dang bde ba yang cig car snang bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po dang bde ba yang cig car snang bar byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that blue and pleasure are not illuminated simultaneously is:

original: rim byis 'dzin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim byis 'dzin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If they are apprehended in sequence.

original: gzugs rig pa yin na bde ba rig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs rig pa yin na bde ba rig pa ma yin la /
translated: If form is cognized, pleasure is not cognized.ğŸ”½If this is cognized, form is not cognized.

original: 'di rig na yang gzugs ma yin no zhes rig pa bzhin du mi rig pa'i myur bar mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rig na yang gzugs ma yin no zhes rig pa bzhin du mi rig pa'i myur bar mtshungs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that they are not cognized in the same way is:

original: de mtshungs min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mtshungs min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are not the same.

original: rnam chad med par rtogs pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam chad med par rtogs pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the realization without interruption is:

original: rtogs pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½mi 'dzin pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas zhes ba ni 'on te mi 'dzin pa yang zhes bya ba la sog pa ni rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa kho na ste zhes bya ba'o // mi 'dzin pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas zhes ba ni 'on te mi 'dzin pa yang zhes bya ba la sog pa ni rgol ba yin no //
translated: It is only the realization.ğŸ”½The objection from the perspective of mere non-apprehension is:

original: med pa'i @101a * //
analyzed: med pa'i @101a * //
translated: If it is not apprehended, then what?

original: tha snyad kyi yul gyi yod pa ma yin pas 'byung ba 'dzin pa yin pa'i dbang du byas nas lan bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½gcig gi ste sa phyogs yod pa ni gzhan dag ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yul gyi yod pa ma yin pas 'byung ba 'dzin pa yin pa'i dbang du byas nas lan bstan pa ni / gcig gi ste sa phyogs yod pa ni gzhan dag ste /
translated: Since it does not exist as a conventional object, the response is presented from the perspective of apprehending an element.ğŸ”½The existence of one, i.e., the place, is expressed as the absence of the other,

original: bum pa med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: i.e., the pot.

original: brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ma yin gyi /
translated: It is expressed not by its own nature,

original: 'on kyang des dben pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang des dben pa nyid kyis so //
translated: but rather by its emptiness of that.

original: 'di dmigs pa'i dus na de ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di dmigs pa'i dus na de ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ba yin te /
translated: When this is observed, that is not observed, as the expression goes.

original: gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two are not always related.

original: des na bden pa 'dzin pa ni de yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na bden pa 'dzin pa ni de yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the expression should be construed as follows: â€œThe apprehension of reality is that.â€

original: de rnam par ma chad pa ni mi 'dzin pa ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par ma chad pa ni mi 'dzin pa ma chad pa'o //
translated: The non-division of that is the non-division of the apprehension.

original: gzugs rig pa nyid bde ba rig pa med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di'i yang bde ba rig pa yin par bstan pa ni bde ba 'dzin pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs rig pa nyid bde ba rig pa med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'di'i yang bde ba rig pa yin par bstan pa ni bde ba 'dzin pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the awareness of form is not the awareness of pleasure, so the awareness of pleasure is not the awareness of form.

original: gnyig la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang gzugs dag gi rig pa ni cig car rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyig la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang gzugs dag gi rig pa ni cig car rig pa ma yin te /
translated: â€œBothâ€ means that the cognition of pleasure and form is not simultaneous.

original: cig car 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang phan tshun gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang phan tshun gegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because they mutually obstruct each other, they are not apprehended simultaneously.

original: de 'di ltar lhan cig mi rig pa dmigs pa yin na mi rigs pa tsam cig car yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ltar lhan cig mi rig pa dmigs pa yin na mi rigs pa tsam cig car yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is the case that they are not simultaneously apprehended, then it is not reasonable that they are the observed object condition of each other.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œOtherwiseâ€ means that if they are not the observed object condition of each other, then they are not simultaneous.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma zhugs pa tsam gyis dben pa 'dzin pa ni dgag pa'i don to //ğŸ”½ma zhugs pa 'dzin pa ni cig car 'dzin pa yin te yan lag dang yan lag can 'dzin pa bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma zhugs pa tsam gyis dben pa 'dzin pa ni dgag pa'i don to // ma zhugs pa 'dzin pa ni cig car 'dzin pa yin te yan lag dang yan lag can 'dzin pa bzhin du yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of negation is that the apprehension of the mere absence of the non-entry of their own natures is simultaneous.ğŸ”½The apprehension of the non-entry is simultaneous apprehension, like the apprehension of parts and a whole.

original: phan tshun rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œMutuallyâ€ means that the apprehension of the mere absence of the non-entry of their own natures is simultaneous.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i ngo bo rig pa la bar gyis 'dzin pa gnod byed ma yin te //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i ngo bo rig pa la bar gyis 'dzin pa gnod byed ma yin te //
translated: â€œHereâ€ means that the apprehension of the mere absence of the non-entry of their own natures is simultaneous.

original: mi 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œNon-apprehensionâ€ is to be supplied with â€œapprehension.â€

original: de la zhes bya ba ni thag ring po'i gong bu snang ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni thag ring po'i gong bu snang ba la'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the appearance of the distant object.

original: ci las she na /ğŸ”½yod min ji ltar gnod byed yin //
analyzed: ci las she na / yod min ji ltar gnod byed yin //
translated: Why?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: â€œHow can what does not exist be a harm?â€

original: gnod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'dod pa ma yin pa ni kho bo cag gi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'dod pa ma yin pa ni kho bo cag gi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œNot being harmedâ€ is to be supplied with â€œis not desired by us.â€

original: nyams su myong ba mngon sum ma yin na gzugs nyams su myong ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba mngon sum ma yin na gzugs nyams su myong ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: If the experience were not a perception, form would not be experienced.

original: rang nyid gsal ba med par zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½ji srid du gzhan gyis gsal bar mi byed de srid pa gzugs nyams su myong ba med la /
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba med par zhes bya ba'o // ji srid du gzhan gyis gsal bar mi byed de srid pa gzugs nyams su myong ba med la /
translated: â€œWithout itself being manifestâ€ means that it is not manifest.ğŸ”½As long as it is not manifested by another, form is not experienced.

original: nyams su myong ba gzhan yang ji srid du mngon sum ma yin pa de srid @101b du gzugs kyi nyams su myong ba ma yin te de nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum nyid kho na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzhan yang ji srid du mngon sum ma yin pa de srid @101b du gzugs kyi nyams su myong ba ma yin te de nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum nyid kho na mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And as long as the experience is not a perception, form is not experienced, because the experience is a perception only if it is a perception.

original: de med na nyams su myong ba thams cad med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de med na nyams su myong ba thams cad med par bstan pa ni /
translated: If that is not so, then all experience is shown to be nonexistent.

original: gsal bar byed pa gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
translated: â€œ Another illuminatorâ€ is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi nyams su myong ba nyid kyi mngon sum ni bde ba 'dzin pa ma yin pa'am /ğŸ”½bde ba gzugs kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi nyams su myong ba nyid kyi mngon sum ni bde ba 'dzin pa ma yin pa'am / bde ba gzugs kyi'o //
translated: Therefore, the direct perception of the experience of form does not apprehend pleasure, or pleasure is form.

original: nges dben pa las 'dzin pa gzhan gyi gzung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges dben pa las 'dzin pa gzhan gyi gzung ba ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the apprehension of pleasure is not the apprehension of something else is shown.

original: snang bar gyur pa de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: â€œ Those that appearâ€ are mentioned.

original: gnod par byed pa ma yin par su smra de nyid kyi phyir res 'ga' gnod par byed pa zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ma yin par su smra de nyid kyi phyir res 'ga' gnod par byed pa zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Who says that it is not a harm-doer? Therefore, it is said that sometimes it is a harm-doer.

original: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa zhes zer ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa zhes zer ba ste /
translated: Or, it is said that it is the apprehension of pleasure.

original: gong bu 'dzin pa'i dus su skra shad kyi bar du 'dzin pa mi skyed pa de bzhin du bde ba 'dzin pa skyes pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gong bu 'dzin pa bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: gong bu 'dzin pa'i dus su skra shad kyi bar du 'dzin pa mi skyed pa de bzhin du bde ba 'dzin pa skyes pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gong bu 'dzin pa bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Just as when the apprehension of a mass is produced, the apprehension of a hair in the middle is not produced, in the same way, the apprehension of pleasure is not produced. Therefore, just as the apprehension of a mass, the apprehension of form is a harm-doer.

analyzed: 'di'i gnod byed yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, â€œIt is a harm-doer.â€

analyzed: res 'ga' gnod byed ma yin pa mi skye ba'i phyir thams cad du gnod byed ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Sometimes, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced, therefore, it is not always the non-existent that is apprehended.

analyzed: skra shad rnams kyi yang bar 'dzin pa thag ring po ma skyes pa nyid gnod par byed pa yin gyi skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /

analyzed: kun tshe ci'i phyir gnod ma gyur // ces bya ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.

analyzed: skra'i bar 'dzin pa ltar zhes bya ba ni gong bu 'dzin pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.ğŸ”½Therefore, the non-apprehension of the non-existent is not produced in regard to the hairs, etc. that are not produced in the vicinity.

original: 'on te don las skye bzhin pa bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig par thal bar 'gyur pas de yang gsal bar snang ngo snyam du sems pa la gcig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te don las skye bzhin pa bde ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig par thal bar 'gyur pas de yang gsal bar snang ngo snyam du sems pa la gcig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if it is arising from the object, it would follow that the object, such as pleasure, would be simultaneous with it. Therefore, it is the appearance of the object that is the cause of the cognition.

original: des phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa 'dzin pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ma lus par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa 'dzin pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ma lus par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œBecause of thatâ€ means that because there is no difference in apprehending what is not a cause, it follows that it would apprehend everything.

original: de nus grub med phyir //
analyzed: de nus grub med phyir //
translated: Because it is not established that that is possible.

original: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni /

original: don gyi bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //

original: gal te don gyi rnam pa can be ba la 'di dag gis dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /

analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba smos te /
