original: mig don la mngon du phyogs pa ma gtogs pa'i don la ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mig don la mngon du phyogs pa ma gtogs pa'i don la ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The five consciousnesses do not have an object, because they do not grasp an object.

original: don la phyogs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don la phyogs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The five consciousnesses do

original: rtog pa'i don la yang rig pa gzhan ni khyad par byed pa por mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni grub par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i don la yang rig pa gzhan ni khyad par byed pa por mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni grub par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement â€œit is not establishedâ€ shows that another cognition does not act as a differentiator of the object of cognition.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig snang bzhin pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig snang bzhin pa nyid las so //
translated: â€œFrom thatâ€ means from the simultaneous appearance.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ means not the cognition itself.

original: tha dad pa rigs pa las don rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa rigs pa las don rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement â€œit is not establishedâ€ shows that a different object of cognition is not cognized by a cognition.

original: des ni de zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: des ni de zhes bya ba'o /
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ means by the cognition.

original: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas 'dzin pa las nang nyid rtogs pa yin par mi 'grub pa ste sngon po bzhin no //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes pas 'dzin pa las nang nyid rtogs pa yin par mi 'grub pa ste sngon po bzhin no //
translated: It is not established that the cognition apprehends the object of cognition because it is included in the same cognition, like blue.

original: nga'i bde ba yin no zhes phyi rol nyid rig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /ğŸ”½'ga' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
analyzed: nga'i bde ba yin no zhes phyi rol nyid rig pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni / 'ga' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
translated: If you think that it is not established because it is cognized as external, like â€œmy pleasure,â€

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is as stated in the line â€œSome say pleasure and so on are external.â€

original: shes pa las phyi rol nyid yin na /
analyzed: shes pa las phyi rol nyid yin na /
translated: If it is external to the cognition,ğŸ”½then it is not cognized.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la sngon po med pa bzhin du de med kyang shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la sngon po med pa bzhin du de med kyang shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as blue does not exist in pleasure, etc., consciousness would arise even though it does not exist, but it does not arise.

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na de yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na de yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is just the nature of that:

original: de'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œand that also.â€

original: shes pa las phyi rol yin na sngon po dang lhan cig pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa las phyi rol yin na sngon po dang lhan cig pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If it were external to consciousness, it would be simultaneous with blue,ğŸ”½but it is not simultaneous like yellow.

original: ser po bzhin du lhan cig pa ma yin pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba la rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ni bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ser po bzhin du lhan cig pa ma yin pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba la rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba ni bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The connection is â€œpleasure, etc.â€

original: shes pa'i dbye ba med na sngon po'i dbye ba med pa ci 'dra ba yin zhes bsam dgos so //ğŸ”½de tsam lnga rnams las zhes bya ba dang @106a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye ba med na sngon po'i dbye ba med pa ci 'dra ba yin zhes bsam dgos so // de tsam lnga rnams las zhes bya ba dang @106a * //
translated: If there is no division of consciousness, it must be considered what kind of division of blue there is.

original: 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The connection is â€œfrom the five just mentioned.â€

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'o //
translated: â€œFiveâ€ refers to the great elements.

original: 'di ltar nga rgyal gyi 'gyur ba'i rnam pa bstan nas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga rgyal gyi 'gyur ba'i rnam pa bstan nas rnam pa gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the transformation of pride, he teaches another aspect:

original: blo'i dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: blo'i dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The five sense faculties of cognition.

original: nga rgyal las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Pride is to be supplied.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gtso bo yongs su gyur pa rnams kyis kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gtso bo yongs su gyur pa rnams kyis kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If the transformations of the essence of the self, such as pleasure, are also the essence of pleasure, etc., what is the certainty?

original: rnam par 'gyur ba yang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba yang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The transformations are also by nature.

original: shes pa dang tha mi dad pas bde ba la sogs pa de dang lhan cig 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang tha mi dad pas bde ba la sogs pa de dang lhan cig 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is not different from consciousness, pleasure, etc., are not apprehended together with it.

original: 'on kyang bzung ba'i sngon po las tha dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bzung ba'i sngon po las tha dad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: However, since it is different from the apprehended blue, etc.

original: sngo sogs rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngo sogs rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Blue, etc., are by nature.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa yang tha mi dad par mi rigs te /ğŸ”½snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs pa yang tha mi dad par mi rigs te / snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is not reasonable that pleasure, etc., and blue, etc., are not different,ğŸ”½because their appearances are different.ğŸ”½The explanation is:

original: tha dad snang can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad snang can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having different appearances.

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyi gzhung lugs kyis sbyar ba'i tha mi dad pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyi gzhung lugs kyis sbyar ba'i tha mi dad pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The non-difference that is connected by the system of individual appearances is not reasonable.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gtso bo'i rang bzhin can nyid do zhes bya ba ga las yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i gtso bo'i rang bzhin can nyid do zhes bya ba ga las yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The question is: â€œHow can it be that the nature of the primary nature is the nature of pleasure and so forth?â€

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa kho na zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa kho na zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the question is: â€œHow can it be that pleasure and so forth alone are the nature of the primary nature?â€

original: rgyu las dang rang bzhin las kyang sngon po la sogs pa rnams la dri ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las dang rang bzhin las kyang sngon po la sogs pa rnams la dri ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The question is also stated in terms of cause and nature with regard to blue and so forth.

original: rlung sgra nyid du gyur pa dang / sgra'i rdul phra rab rnams sgra nyid du gyur pa yang zhes bya bar mtshams gcad do //
analyzed: rlung sgra nyid du gyur pa dang / sgra'i rdul phra rab rnams sgra nyid du gyur pa yang zhes bya bar mtshams gcad do //
translated: The text reads: â€œThe wind itself becomes sound, and the subtle particles of sound become sound.â€

original: rlung gi rngul phra rab rnams kyi sgra phra mo gang yin pa de der 'gyur ro zhes ngag gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: rlung gi rngul phra rab rnams kyi sgra phra mo gang yin pa de der 'gyur ro zhes ngag gcig nyid yin no //
translated: The subtle sound of the subtle particles of wind becomes that. This is the single statement.

original: de grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not established.

original: 'dod pa tsam las ni 'ga'i yang 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam las ni 'ga'i yang 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that nothing is established by mere desire.

original: bum pa'i dpe las 'di yang rigs mthun pa'i rgyu nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa la dpe 'di las rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu nyid du sgrub par byed pas 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bum pa'i dpe las 'di yang rigs mthun pa'i rgyu nyid yin na bum pa la sogs pa la dpe 'di las rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu nyid du sgrub par byed pas 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: This is contradictory, because this example of the pot is a homogeneous cause, but the example of the pot proves that it is a heterogeneous cause.

original: 'bras bu gang ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is shown by â€œwhatever effect there is.â€

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a homogeneous cause that is not simultaneous.

original: 'on te de'i 'og tu khyed sgrub byed la yang phyin cig log tu sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te thams cad nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de'i 'og tu khyed sgrub byed la yang phyin cig log tu sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te thams cad nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that even in the proof of that, the example is established in a contradictory way, then it is said, â€œIf everything is like that.â€

original: mig @106b mngon pa ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i mngon par mi gsal ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: mig @106b mngon pa ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i mngon par mi gsal ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ikas say that the nature of the unmanifest is not manifest, but the nature of the manifest is manifest.

original: mngon par gsal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is shown by â€œmanifest and unmanifest.â€

original: phyi rol gyi bud med la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i blo la snang bzhin pa goms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byed kyi phyi rol ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bud med la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i blo la snang bzhin pa goms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byed kyi phyi rol ni ma yin te /
translated: The difference is made by the special cultivation of the appearance of pleasure, etc., in the mind, together with an external woman, etc., and not by an external object.ğŸ”½If there were no difference from that, i.e., from the mind, pleasure, etc., would not be different, and the teaching of their difference would be pointless.

original: de las tha mi dad pa ste khyad par med pa la ni bde ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par can du mi 'gyur te de bzhin kho na yin par bstan pa ni de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ste chos lhag pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de las tha mi dad pa ste khyad par med pa la ni bde ba la sogs pa la yang khyad par can du mi 'gyur te de bzhin kho na yin par bstan pa ni de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ste chos lhag pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference of that is the difference of the additional property.

original: de kho na ma yin par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na ma yin par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not being different from that is not being different from the external.

original: goms pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa las byung ba yin gyi phyi rol ma yin no zhes rgyu'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa las byung ba yin gyi phyi rol ma yin no zhes rgyu'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The difference of the cause is taught: pleasure, etc., which are made different by cultivation, arise from cultivation, not from an external object.

original: yul gyi dbye ba las 'di dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba las 'di dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference of the object is taught:

original: phyi rol yin na zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: phyi rol yin na zhes bya ba'o//
translated: If it were external, it would be different from the mind.

original: blo dang lhan cig pa'i bde ba la sogs pa tha mi dad pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: blo dang lhan cig pa'i bde ba la sogs pa tha mi dad pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that one definitely apprehends pleasure, etc. as not different from the mind.

original: yang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo de'i rang bzhin de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas grub pa bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo de'i rang bzhin de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas grub pa bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of that pleasure, etc. is not established by that very nature of pleasure, etc.

original: sems pa can gyi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sems pa can gyi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because the nature of the sentient being is not established.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that it is not an external nature is:

original: gal te blo yang bde sogs kyi //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te blo yang bde sogs kyi // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the mind is also pleasure, etc.

original: cig car 'dzin pa la 'gal ba nyid med pa'am /
analyzed: cig car 'dzin pa la 'gal ba nyid med pa'am /
translated: The simultaneous apprehension of pleasure, etc. is not contradictory.

original: phyi rol gyi khyad par la khyad par gyi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khyad par la khyad par gyi'o //
translated: Or, it is the difference of the external.

original: bde ba la sogs pa sems can ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sems can ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if pleasure, etc. are not sentient beings,

original: phyi rol nyid ni dmigs pa'i yul kho na ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid ni dmigs pa'i yul kho na ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: they are not just external objects of perception.

original: da ni phyi de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni phyi de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, that external is said.

original: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: Again and again means engaging in a continuum.

original: 'brel pa ma yin pa ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid ma grub na gtso bo'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma yin pa ni bde ba la sogs pa nyid ma grub na gtso bo'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If pleasure, etc. themselves are not established, then the transformation of the primal substance itself is not established.

original: de nyid yin par nges zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yongs su gyur pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid yin par nges zhes bya ba ni gtso bo yongs su gyur pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: â€œ It is certain that it is thatâ€ means that the transformation of the primal substance is certain.

original: de yongs su gyur pa nyid grub pa yin yang de'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa ma yin te/ yin yang de'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa nyid grub pa yin yang de'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa ma yin te/ yin yang de'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the transformation of that is established, its nature cannot be cognized,ğŸ”½because it is seen to be different.

original: gzhan nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni me yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni me yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œ The nature of the transformation of fireâ€ is stated.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i @107a */
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i @107a */
translated: The cognition of pleasure, etc.ğŸ”½would not be the apprehender of sound, etc., which are not of the nature of that.

original: blo ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo sgra la sogs pa la 'dzin byed du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas bde ba la sogs pa grub po snyam du sems pa la /ğŸ”½gal te rigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo ni de ma yin pa'i ngo bo sgra la sogs pa la 'dzin byed du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas bde ba la sogs pa grub po snyam du sems pa la /ğŸ”½gal te rigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that they are different, pleasure, etc. are established.ğŸ”½If the primal substance is the cause of pleasure, etc., then the cognition of pleasure, etc. would not be the apprehender of sound, etc., which are not of the nature of that.

original: sgra la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: If sound and so on are not pleasure and so on,

original: blo ni 'dzin byed ma yin zhing 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: blo ni 'dzin byed ma yin zhing 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
translated: then the mind is not the apprehender and it is not the effect.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bu nyid kho na 'dzin byed nyid dang rang gi rnam pa'i 'dzin byed nyid ni gzung bya nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bu nyid kho na 'dzin byed nyid dang rang gi rnam pa'i 'dzin byed nyid ni gzung bya nyid yin te /
translated: The effect that has its aspect is the apprehender and the apprehender of its aspect is the object to be apprehended.

original: de med na der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de med na der yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te /
translated: If that does not exist, it is illogical to say that it is that.

original: skyes bu 'bras bu ma yin yang 'dzin byed nyid dang sgra la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa yang gzung bya nyid du mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu 'bras bu ma yin yang 'dzin byed nyid dang sgra la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa yang gzung bya nyid du mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ba la /
translated: Even though a person is not an effect, it is seen that he is the apprehender and even though sound and so on are not causes, they are objects to be apprehended.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gsal zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gsal zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause and effect are clear.

original: gal te blo dang sgra la sogs pa dang / bde ba dag 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid yod pa'i yin pa de lta na gzhan la yang ste /
analyzed: gal te blo dang sgra la sogs pa dang / bde ba dag 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid yod pa'i yin pa de lta na gzhan la yang ste /
translated: If the mind, sound and so on, and pleasure are the object to be apprehended and the apprehender because they exist as the effect and cause, then so too are others.

original: bdag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de nyid yod pa de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyor bar byed pa ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de nyid yod pa de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyor bar byed pa ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The syllogism is stated by the words â€œbecause of the existence of the grasped and grasper,â€ which means that the effect and cause would exist.

original: 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba ni dngos su de las bzlog pa ni shugs kyis bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba ni dngos su de las bzlog pa ni shugs kyis bstan pa yin la /
translated: The reductio is stated directly, but the reverse proposition is stated indirectly.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu min pa'am zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba la ni bzlog pa dang thal bar 'gyur yang dngos su yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu min pa'am zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba la ni bzlog pa dang thal bar 'gyur yang dngos su yin no //
translated: In the disjunctive syllogism, â€œnot being effect and cause,â€ the reverse proposition and the reductio are stated directly.

original: yod na'am zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid na'o //
analyzed: yod na'am zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid na'o //
translated: â€œIf it existsâ€ means if effect and cause exist.

original: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //ğŸ”½de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur par brjod pa'o //ğŸ”½de bstan pa ni yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o // de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur par brjod pa'o // de bstan pa ni yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn anotherâ€ means in the self.ğŸ”½â€œThatâ€ refers to the effect and cause.ğŸ”½â€œThat is taughtâ€ is â€œeither the effect and cause.â€

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa'am zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin te /
translated: â€œOr being effect and causeâ€ is the reverse proposition.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid med par brjod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid med par brjod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the object, etc., the non-existence of the result, etc. is stated.

original: yod na'am zhes bya ba ni gzung ba nyid de 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: yod na'am zhes bya ba ni gzung ba nyid de 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid na'o //
translated: If it exists, as the object, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid do //ğŸ”½dngos po de las gzhan la yang de bdag la'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa nyid do // dngos po de las gzhan la yang de bdag la'o //
translated: That, the result, etc.ğŸ”½From that entity, other than that, also in the self.

original: bdag la yang 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la yang 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Also in the self, it would follow.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa nyid @107b rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa nyid @107b rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the establishment of cognition.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs gzung ba yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs gzung ba yang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Like blue, etc., pleasure, etc. are also of the nature of cognition,

original: de ma yin pa'i ngo bos mi rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i ngo bos mi rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because they are not cognized by a nature that is not that. This is stated:

original: gang gi rang bzhin myong ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin myong ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of which is not experienced.

original: rig pa nyid kyang de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te phyi rol ma dmigs pa'i phyir rigs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur la sngon po la sogs pa ni rig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin yang phyi rol yin te /
analyzed: rig pa nyid kyang de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te phyi rol ma dmigs pa'i phyir rigs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur la sngon po la sogs pa ni rig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin yang phyi rol yin te /
translated: And awareness itself is included in that, because it is not observed as external, it is only the nature of awareness. But blue, etc. are included in awareness, but they are external,

original: phyi rol gyi don byed par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don byed par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because they are able to perform the function of external objects.

original: phyi rol nyid tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that external objects are not established by valid cognition is stated in the line: â€œbecause external objects are not established by valid cognition.â€

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo'i rjes su mthun pa rig pa ma yin no zhes gang bstan pa de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi ngo bo'i rjes su mthun pa rig pa ma yin no zhes gang bstan pa de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The statement that pleasure, etc. are not awareness that is in accord with the nature of external objects is explained in the line:

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe aspect of pleasure, etc.â€

original: blo la gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can rig par byed pa ni shin tu nye ba du ma yang gcig bzhin du snang ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: blo la gnas pa'i bde ba la sogs pa dang sems pa can rig par byed pa ni shin tu nye ba du ma yang gcig bzhin du snang ba ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The thought that the pleasure, etc. that exist in the mind and the sentient being that is aware of them are very close, but many appear as one is stated in the line:

original: gal te de rang bzhin min pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de rang bzhin min pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf that is not its nature.â€

original: myong bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: myong bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: â€œBy experienceâ€ means by the experience of the object.

original: rig pa las tha dad pa'i blo'i gzhung lugs ni tshad ma'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos kyi grags pas /
analyzed: rig pa las tha dad pa'i blo'i gzhung lugs ni tshad ma'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos kyi grags pas /
translated: The system of the intellect that is different from awareness is not in accord with valid cognition. Therefore, the Bhagavat DharmakÄ«rti said:

original: mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can //ğŸ”½myong ba ma gtogs 'dir blo gang //
analyzed: mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can // myong ba ma gtogs 'dir blo gang //
translated: Direct perception has the aspect of memory.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Here, the intellect is not separate from experience.

original: sgom pa grub pa na zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang / de sgrub pa la btang snyoms bsgom pa thob pa na'o //
analyzed: sgom pa grub pa na zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang / de sgrub pa la btang snyoms bsgom pa thob pa na'o //
translated: â€œWhen meditation is accomplishedâ€ means when one has attained the meditation of equanimity that accomplishes pleasure, etc.

original: cha tsam spong bar mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: cha tsam spong bar mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is seen to abandon the parts.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gong nas gong du spong ba mthong ba'i phyir rig pa gzhan kho na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gong nas gong du spong ba mthong ba'i phyir rig pa gzhan kho na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Because it is seen to abandon pleasure and pain in succession, another awareness is definitely connected with pleasure and pain.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal las grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal las grol ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the same wayâ€ means liberation from pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa dang / sems pa can gang du gzugs brnyan gyi sbyor bas 'dres pa de blo ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa 'dres pa nyid kyi sems pa can gcig nyid yin gyi de'i gzhir gyur pa'i blo gzhan dmigs pa ma yinğŸ”½par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa dang / sems pa can gang du gzugs brnyan gyi sbyor bas 'dres pa de blo ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa 'dres pa nyid kyi sems pa can gcig nyid yin gyi de'i gzhir gyur pa'i blo gzhan dmigs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The mind that is mixed with pleasure, blue, etc., is one and the same, and the mind that is its basis is not observed.

original: de dang de don la brten nas zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: de dang de don la brten nas zhes bya ba'o//
translated: This is taught by â€œin dependence on that and that object.â€

original: @108a * // blo dang bde ba dang rig pa rnams chu dang 'o ma bzhin du shin tu 'dres pa ni tha dad par ma dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @108a * // blo dang bde ba dang rig pa rnams chu dang 'o ma bzhin du shin tu 'dres pa ni tha dad par ma dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind, pleasure, and awareness are very mixed, like water and milk, and they are not observed as different.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: But is it not the case that they are not different?

original: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by â€œlike a lump of iron and fire.â€

original: tha mi dad par rig kyang tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: tha mi dad par rig kyang tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
translated: If they are established as different even though they are not different,

original: tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir tha dad par yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de lta yin na dngos kun la //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir tha dad par yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de lta yin na dngos kun la // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so, all thingsğŸ”½would not be different.

original: tha mi dad par rig pa la tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag par mi byed pas /
analyzed: tha mi dad par rig pa la tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag par mi byed pas /
translated: If one does not posit non-different things as non-different,

original: tha mi dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin nam /
translated: wouldnâ€™t non-difference itself be undermined?

original: de ji ltar tha dad pa nyams pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar tha dad pa nyams pa yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: How could difference be undermined?

original: tha dad med min gcig yin no //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad med min gcig yin no // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are not non-different, but one.

original: tha mi dad par rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma yod na de las bzlog pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma yod na de las bzlog pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is a valid cognition that posits non-difference, then the opposite, difference, is posited. Otherwise, it is not. This is the meaning.

original: tha mi dad pa'i snang ba ni tha dad pa la tha dad pa'i snang ba dang / tha dad pa'i snang ba ni yang tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa'i snang ba khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i snang ba ni tha dad pa la tha dad pa'i snang ba dang / tha dad pa'i snang ba ni yang tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa'i snang ba khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan pa ni /

original: sdug bsngal dkar sogs tha dad snang //ğŸ”½zhes bya bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dkar sogs tha dad snang // zhes bya bas /
translated: such as the suffering of white, etc.

original: tha mi dad pa la tha dad pa la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la tha dad pa la khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The demonstration of the contradiction of the pervasion of non-difference in the different is:

original: sems las byung ba reg pa dang sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba thams cad ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par mtshon pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba reg pa dang sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba thams cad ni bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par mtshon pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /

original: de dag tha dad pa ma yin par ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa ma yin par ma yin nam /
translated: would they not be non-different?

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa'i rigs pa ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa la tha mi dad pa'i rigs pa ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reasoning of non-difference in the different is not a contradiction of the pervasion.

original: khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la bsgribs pa rnams gcig gi tshe nye bar mtshon pa na gsal ba ste /
analyzed: khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la bsgribs pa rnams gcig gi tshe nye bar mtshon pa na gsal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the self is the support of the mind.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½Objection: The self is the support of the mind.ğŸ”½

original: bde ba la sogs pas rgyun la rgyu la sgrib par byed pa med na tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab pa grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas rgyun la rgyu la sgrib par byed pa med na tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab pa grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that when one of the obscurations is present, pleasure, etc. are not manifest.ğŸ”½But when there is no obscuration, they are manifest, and thus the pervasion is established.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yang tha mi dad par rig pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yang tha mi dad par rig pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The mind and mental factors are also similar to pleasure, etc., because they are the objects of cognition that is not different.

original: de ltar @108b khas len pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar @108b khas len pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase â€œit is not accepted that wayâ€ is that they are not similar.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Pleasure, etc. are feeling, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par dpyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par dpyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes investigation, etc.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sgrib par byed pa med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sgrib par byed pa med na'o //
translated: â€œAt other timesâ€ means when there is no obscuration.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems la rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du shes yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems la rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du shes yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Even though the nonconceptual mind does not have the nature of apprehending representations,

original: sems thams cad la sems pa la sogs pa rnams med pa ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: sems thams cad la sems pa la sogs pa rnams med pa ma yin pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Is it not the case that all minds are not without intentionality, etc.?

original: gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½lta ba 'khor bas rab zab pa'i //
analyzed: gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o // lta ba 'khor bas rab zab pa'i //
translated: It is not so, because of the apprehension of signs, etc.ğŸ”½The river of envy is very deep,

original: phrag dog chu bos yongs 'khrul pas//
analyzed: phrag dog chu bos yongs 'khrul pas//
translated: because of the view of cyclic existence.

original: skye bo rnams ni ma rgyal na //
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni ma rgyal na //
translated: If people are not conquered by it,

original: rgyal ba can gzhan su zhig yin //ğŸ”½blang dang dor bya'i de nyid kyi //ğŸ”½thabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba can gzhan su zhig yin // blang dang dor bya'i de nyid kyi // thabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
translated: by what other conqueror are they conquered?ğŸ”½The method of knowing the realityğŸ”½of what is to be taken up and what is to be laid aside,

original: gang de tshad ma nyid 'dod kyi //
analyzed: gang de tshad ma nyid 'dod kyi //
translated: is accepted as valid cognition,

original: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no //
translated: but not as the knower of all.

original: zhes bya bas rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni rnal 'byor shes pa sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ni rnal 'byor shes pa sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that this teaches the consciousness of the yogi is â€œthe consciousness of the yogi, as previously explained.â€

original: de yang mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i chos nyid la dmigs pa yin gyi mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i chos nyid la dmigs pa yin gyi mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is an object of the general reality of impermanence, emptiness, etc., but it is not direct perception,

original: rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: because it is conceptual.

original: mngon sum nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du rtogs pa med pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du rtogs pa med pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to establish that directly, he teaches that it is non-conceptual:

original: gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin //
translated: It appears as clarity.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is:

original: chos nyid ni chos las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The reality of phenomena is not different from phenomena.

original: chos nyid de lta bu yin par rjes su dpag pas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos nyid de lta bu yin par rjes su dpag pas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: one understands it as it is by inferring that such is its reality.

original: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir sngon po mthong ba bzhin du rtog pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni /ğŸ”½rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal bas //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir sngon po mthong ba bzhin du rtog pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni / rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal bas //
translated: In order to teach that it is non-conceptual like the perception of blue, because it is clarity, he says:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It dispels the net of conceptual thought.

original: gal te yang 'u bu cag gi stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni thams cad yod par nges bzhin par brtags pa yin gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yang 'u bu cag gi stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni thams cad yod par nges bzhin par brtags pa yin gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the emptiness, etc. of us is imagined while all exists, but not that of the yogis.

original: ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci las yin zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: sgom byung yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgom byung yin zhes bya ba'o //

original: bdag la sogs pa'i yul la shes pa dang / tshig la yang 'u bu cag la sogs pa the tshom za ba'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /

original: mi gtsang ba'i ro yang dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pas rtogs bya ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i ro yang dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pas rtogs bya ma yin gyi /
translated: The taste of impurity is not an object of knowledge produced by the sense faculties.

original: 'o na ci zhe na yid kyis so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na yid kyis so //
translated: What is it then? It is an object of mental consciousness.

original: de lta na yang dag byed ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta na yang dag byed ma yin na /
translated: Even so, if it is not the cause of passion,

original: thams cad de ltar 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad de ltar 'gyur la /
translated: then everything would be the same as that.

original: gsal ba dang cig shos dag nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa dang cig shos dag gi khyad par yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba dang cig shos dag nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa dang cig shos dag gi khyad par yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference between the yogi/nis who have the clear light and those who do not is not anything else, but this.

original: mi gtsang sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by â€œimpurity, etc.â€

original: bgrod par mi bya ba zhes bya ba ni ma'am sgyug mo la 'gro ba ni bgrod par mi bya ba la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bgrod par mi bya ba zhes bya ba ni ma'am sgyug mo la 'gro ba ni bgrod par mi bya ba la 'gro ba'o //
translated: â€œNot to be gone toâ€ means that going to a mother or mother-in-law is going to what is not to be gone to.

original: gal te yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa nges par rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa nges par rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one were to ascertain that which is not transformed,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rtogs par mi byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rtogs par mi byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that one would not even understand the conceptual.

original: 'on kyang bstan bcos kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan bcos kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by â€œbut in the treatise, etc.â€

original: tha snyad la yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la yang ngo ;
analyzed: tha snyad la yang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la yang ngo ;
translated: â€œAlso in conventional usageâ€ means also in going.

original: ;'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i'o //
analyzed: ;'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the effect.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: â€œTransformationâ€ is a distinction.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i snga ma ni dang po ste de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i snga ma ni dang po ste de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The previous â€œlike thisâ€ is the first, and means â€œimmediately preceding.â€

original: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu kha cig ni brgyud nas yin la /ğŸ”½kha cig ni dngos su yin zhes ci las yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu kha cig ni brgyud nas yin la / kha cig ni dngos su yin zhes ci las yin snyam du sems pa la /
translated: What is the reason for saying that some effects of this cause are indirect,ğŸ”½and some are direct?

original: gang gis 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this question, he says, â€œbecause of the absence of this or that condition.â€

original: rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa rnams med pa de'i phyir brgyud pas yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa rnams med pa de'i phyir brgyud pas yin gyi /
translated: Because of the absence of the cooperating conditions of the cause, the effect is indirect.

original: gang gis yod pa yin pa de'i phyir gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis yod pa yin pa de'i phyir gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the presence of this or that condition, the effect is direct. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyi sems rtogs zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rtogs zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: â€œThe knowledge of the minds of othersâ€ is omniscience.

original: lugs kun zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa'i lugs dang / de sun dbyung ba'i lugs rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: lugs kun zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa'i lugs dang / de sun dbyung ba'i lugs rnams kyang ste /
translated: â€œAll the systemsâ€ are the systems that prove the omniscience of others and the systems that refute them.

original: gzung bya'i don la shes pa gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: gzung bya'i don la shes pa gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid gzhan du zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of â€œin some other wayâ€ is that the object that is grasped is the clarity of the aspect of consciousness.

original: yul gyi rnam pa gsal pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa gsal pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not a valid form of knowledge because the aspect of the object is not clear.

original: mngon sum ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs las so //
translated: â€œIt is not perceptionâ€ because of the state.

original: dran pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: â€œRecollectionâ€ means with discursive thought.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa zhes bya ba ni rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: â€œKnown by othersâ€ means known by another.

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i dus nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i dus nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œAt that very timeâ€ means at the time of the cognition, because it is produced by the cognition itself.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'das pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'das pas so //
translated: â€œBy that very thingâ€ means by the past.

original: mi 'dod ces bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod ces bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
translated: â€œNot acceptedâ€ means not imagined.

original: ci las rnam par @112b rtog pa med pa yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ci las rnam par @112b rtog pa med pa yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: What is the non-discursive cognition?

original: lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œConcealedâ€ means hidden.

original: 'di yang ci las she na /
analyzed: 'di yang ci las she na /
translated: What is this?

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œBy that very thingâ€ means by the past.

original: rnam par rtog pa mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa gcig po rang rig pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa gcig po rang rig pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isnâ€™t the single cognition that desires discursive thought endowed with the activity of self-awareness?

original: don gyi yul la rtog pa nyid gzhan gang yin snyam du sems la /
analyzed: don gyi yul la rtog pa nyid gzhan gang yin snyam du sems la /
translated: What else is the conceptualization of the object domain?

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du don gyi yul nyid du rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhin du don gyi yul nyid du rtog pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that the conceptualization of the object domain is like the conceptualization:

original: sgra'i don de la rung ba nyid ni de la 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don de la rung ba nyid ni de la 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The suitability of the meaning of the word is its apprehension.

original: de la ste don la de ni ste rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: de la ste don la de ni ste rtog pa yin la /
translated: And that, i.e., the object, is that, i.e., the concept.

original: de la 'dzin pa nyid du rung ba ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa nyid du rung ba ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The suitability of its apprehension is excluded.

original: don gyis go ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don gyis go ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The cognition of the meaning of the word is the awareness of the nature of another. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that it is the object of conceptual cognition, he says:

original: 'on te don gyis go bas zhes bya bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas zhes bya bya ba'o //
translated: Or, if it is understood through the meaning, etc.

original: ma grub ba'i rang gi ngo bo don gyis go bas rtogs ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub ba'i rang gi ngo bo don gyis go bas rtogs ba'o //
translated: The nature of the object that is not established is understood through the meaning of the word.

original: ma grub ba'i rang gi ngo bo don gyis go bas rtogs par / mngon sum gyis grub na ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi ngo bo des grub na ste lkog tu gyur pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma grub ba'i rang gi ngo bo don gyis go bas rtogs par / mngon sum gyis grub na ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi ngo bo des grub na ste lkog tu gyur pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the nature of the object that is not established is understood through the meaning of the word, and if it is established by perception, then it is not an object that is hidden, this is the meaning.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: This very, i.e., the nature that is not hidden,

original: shes pas ci zhig bya ba rgyus so //
analyzed: shes pas ci zhig bya ba rgyus so //
translated: what is the use of awareness? It is the cause.

original: mig la sogs pa'i byed pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i byed pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not merely the functioning of the eye, etc.

original: 'on kyang de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bskyed bya'i shes pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is said that it is the consciousness produced by that, then it is called the engagement of the ear, etc.

original: ji ltar shes zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa de'i bskyed bya lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar shes zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa de'i bskyed bya lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo las ma gtogs pa ni /
translated: How is it known? It means that apart from the produced nature of the functioning of the eye, etc.,

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which is not hidden, it is not the object of perception, etc.ğŸ”½If it is said that because it is not deceptive, the knowledge born of meditation is a valid cognition of perception, then because the knowledge of a dream is not deceptive with regard to the object of the dream, it is a valid cognition.

original: gal te bsgoms pa las skyes pa yang mi bslu ba'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na rmi lam gyi shes pa yang rmi lam gyi don la mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba ni /ğŸ”½gal te bsgom pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bsgoms pa las skyes pa yang mi bslu ba'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na rmi lam gyi shes pa yang rmi lam gyi don la mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba ni / gal te bsgom pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that because it is not deceptive, the knowledge born of meditation is a valid cognition of perception, then because the knowledge of a dream is not deceptive with regard to the object of the dream, it is a valid cognition.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la chur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la chur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Deluded consciousness is like seeing a mirage as water.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la sogs pa rnams la shes pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can la sogs pa rnams la shes pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs pa'o //
translated: The so-called cognition is the temporary.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba ci las she na /
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba ci las she na /
translated: From what does the semblance of perception arise?

original: don gzhan ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yan lag can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan yan lag can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other object is the other whole, etc. from form, etc.

original: der zhen pas 'jug pas gang las yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der zhen pas 'jug pas gang las yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it engages by attachment to that, it is said, â€œfrom what?â€

original: gal te bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yan lag can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yan lag can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the cognition called â€œpot,â€ etc. has a whole for its object, why is it not perception?

original: yan lag can ni zhes @113a * //
analyzed: yan lag can ni zhes @113a * //
translated: The whole, etc.

original: bya ba'o // rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'o // rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi shes pa ste /
translated: This cognition of inference is the cognition of a reason.

original: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the cognition that does not occur if the probandum is absent.

original: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni goms pa med na'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni goms pa med na'o //
translated: In some cases, i.e., if there is no practice.

original: smig rgyu la chu dang bcas pa can gyi shes pa dag gzhan dbang po las skyes pa dang / zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'khrul pa med pa can du yang 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu dang bcas pa can gyi shes pa dag gzhan dbang po las skyes pa dang / zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'khrul pa med pa can du yang 'dod pa'o //
translated: The cognitions of a mirage together with water are accepted as being dependent on the sense faculties, and as being non-erroneous with regard to the nature of the attachment.

original: dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis ni dbang po dang don 'brel pa las byung ba nyid kho na rnam par gcod par 'gyur yang rjes dpag rjes su dpag nas byung ba zhes bya ba nas /ğŸ”½'dod pa las byung zhes byang nas /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis ni dbang po dang don 'brel pa las byung ba nyid kho na rnam par gcod par 'gyur yang rjes dpag rjes su dpag nas byung ba zhes bya ba nas / 'dod pa las byung zhes byang nas /
translated: The distinction of not being born from the sense faculties excludes only that which arises from the connection between sense faculty and object.

original: 'dod pa las byung zhes bya ba'i bar du dpe brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa las byung zhes bya ba'i bar du dpe brjod pa yin no //
translated: The example is stated from â€œinferenceâ€ up to â€œarisen from desire.â€ğŸ”½The example is stated from â€œarisen from desireâ€ up to â€œarisen from desire.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba brjod pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye ba brjod pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The purpose of stating the classification of conceptualization is stated:

original: dbang skyes min pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang skyes min pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œnot born from the sense faculties.â€

original: snga ma gnyis la dbang po las skyes pa nyid du mngon par sems pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de skyed par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po'i yod pa la bar mtshams med pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma gnyis la dbang po las skyes pa nyid du mngon par sems pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de skyed par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pa dbang po'i yod pa la bar mtshams med pas so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason for the notion that the former two are born from the sense-faculties is that the form, etc. which produces them, and the consciousness of a mirage, etc. are uninterrupted in the existence of the sense-faculties.

original: brda gang gi rten yin pa de yin pa'i yan lag can dang gzhan yod bzhin dran bzhin pa'i chu la sogs pa'i don de dag go rims bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dag ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid du 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: brda gang gi rten yin pa de yin pa'i yan lag can dang gzhan yod bzhin dran bzhin pa'i chu la sogs pa'i don de dag go rims bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dag ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid du 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: The superimposition and the conceptualization of those objects, water, etc. which are the members of the word-symbol, which exist, and which are remembered, are the cause of the error that they are born from the sense-faculties.

original: ci las she na 'ga'i tshe mngon sum rjes su 'jug pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci las she na 'ga'i tshe mngon sum rjes su 'jug pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From what? Because sometimes they follow the direct perception.

original: bla lhag tu sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las lhag pa'i yan lag can gyi'o //
analyzed: bla lhag tu sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las lhag pa'i yan lag can gyi'o //
translated: The superimposition of the excess is that of the members of the word-symbol which are in excess of form, etc.

original: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i chu nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i chu nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The seeing is the experience of the former water.

original: bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa ste sngar mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: bzlog ste zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa ste sngar mthong ba la'o //
translated: â€œThe oppositeâ€ is the other order, i.e., the previously seen.

original: rnam rtog ni zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog ni zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i'o //
translated: â€œConceptualizationâ€ is the non-existence of the prior.

original: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni chu la yang sko 'dogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa la'am yan lag can la'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni chu la yang sko 'dogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa la'am yan lag can la'o //
translated: â€œBothâ€ is the superimposition on water, i.e., conceptualization or the whole.

original: 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba khas blangs nas /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba khas blangs nas /
translated: â€œBecause of engagementâ€ is accepted.

original: 'ga' tshe zhes bya ba de dang sbyar nas phyogs gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' tshe zhes bya ba de dang sbyar nas phyogs gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: â€œSometimesâ€ is connected with that, and the other side is shown.

original: nye bar 'jug pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'jug pa nyid dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œJust the engagementâ€ is just the engagement in the near.

original: de nyid dam zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dag go //
analyzed: de nyid dam zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dag go //
translated: â€œThat itselfâ€ is the superimposition and the conceptualization.

original: des zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' mngon sum dang / nye ba la 'jug pa @113b nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab par mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' mngon sum dang / nye ba la 'jug pa @113b nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab par mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ is sometimes the experience by the engagement in the near, which is dependent on the memory of the sign, and the non-perception by the non-engagement in the near. The pervasion is shown by the non-perception of the near.

original: ji ltar lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: â€œHow is it hidden?â€

original: brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid ni dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum nyid la 'gal bas khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid ni dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum nyid la 'gal bas khyab pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is contradictory for the arising of a direct perception from a sense faculty to depend on the memory of a sign.ğŸ”½Even if it is not like that,

original: de lta ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med kyang zhes bstan pa nyid kyi bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med kyang zhes bstan pa nyid kyi bshad pa ni /
translated: the explanation of the teaching that even if the whole does not exist,

original: yul gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: the object is the same.

original: don gcig la ni sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gcig bzhin no //
analyzed: don gcig la ni sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gcig bzhin no //
translated: The application to the same object is because of the same effect, like the word â€œcow.â€

original: de 'gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni reg pa 'gyur na gzugs 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni reg pa 'gyur na gzugs 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it changes, it changes, because if contact changes, form changes.

original: tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba ni yan lag can no //
translated: The difference is the whole.

original: gsum po zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa dang yan lag can no //
analyzed: gsum po zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa dang yan lag can no //
translated: The three are form, contact, and the whole.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i 'du ba'i'o //

analyzed: de'i 'gyes pa ni 'du ba dang ldan pa las mi 'gyes pa yin no //

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa yang rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum thob par 'gyur ba la dmigs kyis bsal bar byed pa ni rab rib dang bcas pa smos pas zhes bstan
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa yang rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum thob par 'gyur ba la dmigs kyis bsal bar byed pa ni rab rib dang bcas pa smos pas zhes bstan
translated: The statement â€œdirect perception is free from conceptual thoughtâ€ is a specific refutation of the assertion that the cognition of two moons is direct perception, because it is free from conceptual thought.

analyzed: pa ni / 'dir bzhi pa dmigs bsal te zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: spyi mthong ba las zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan las so //
translated: â€œFrom the perception of the generalâ€ means from the reason.

original: rab rib dang bcas pas smos pa zhes bya ba ni lan yin te /

translated: â€œThe mention of the one with cataractsâ€ is the answer.

analyzed: don la khyad par med pa'i phyir tshig gi khyad par la de ma thag pa med pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: â€œDirect perception is non-mistakenâ€ is the definition.

original: de ni bden te zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bden te zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //

translated: The explanation of the purpose of mentioning freedom from conceptuality is
